subj:01000000.name: arts, culture and entertainment
subj:01000000.description: Matters pertaining to the advancement and refinement of the human mind, of interests, skills, tastes and emotions

subj:01001000.name: archaeology
subj:01001000.description: Probing the past through ruins and artefacts

subj:01002000.name: architecture
subj:01002000.description: Designing of buildings, monuments and the spaces around them

subj:01003000.name: bullfighting
subj:01003000.description: Classical contest pitting man against the bull

subj:01004000.name: festive event (including carnival)
subj:01004000.description: Parades, parties, celebrations and the like not necessarily tied to a fixed occasion or date

subj:01005001.name: film festival
subj:01005001.description: National and international motion pictures festivals, selections, festival juries, nominations, awards etc.

subj:01006000.name: dance
subj:01006000.description: The expression of emotion or message through movement

subj:01007000.name: fashion
subj:01007000.description: The design of clothing and accessories

subj:01008000.name: language
subj:01008000.description: The means by which people communicate with each other

subj:01009000.name: library and museum
subj:01009000.description: Edifices used to house collections of books, music, art, or objects from the past and present for public use and display

subj:01010000.name: literature
subj:01010000.description: The use of pamphlets, books or other printed matter to convey ideas, stories or other messages for the public

subj:01010001.name: fiction
subj:01010001.description: Structured stories that are usually not based on fact but are the creation of the authors imagination

subj:01010002.name: poetry
subj:01010002.description: The art, structure, forms of poetic expression

subj:01011000.name: music
subj:01011000.description: Expressing emotion or message through instruments or voice using different sounds, tones, harmonies and the like

subj:01011001.name: classical music
subj:01011001.description: Music that follows classic structures of rhythm and harmony

subj:01011002.name: folk music
subj:01011002.description: Music that developed from folk cultures, often based on story-telling

subj:01011003.name: jazz music
subj:01011003.description: A music of diverse harmonics, often improvised

subj:01011004.name: popular music
subj:01011004.description: The latest fad in music, generally aimed at the younger generation

subj:01011005.name: country music
subj:01011005.description: Similar to folk but is unique to the United States and is less about story telling than about loves sought and lost

subj:01011006.name: rock and roll music
subj:01011006.description: Popular dance music developed in the 1950s

subj:01011007.name: hip-hop
subj:01011007.description: A contemporary urban music originating in the 1970s.

subj:01012000.name: painting
subj:01012000.description: Using the mediums of oils, watercolour, pastel, pencils, chalk, crayon etc on various grounds to express emotion or message

subj:01013000.name: photography
subj:01013000.description: Mechanical means of creating images of objects by use of light and light sensitive materials with chemicals or by digitals means

subj:01015000.name: sculpture
subj:01015000.description: Representation of forms in clays, stone, woods, metals or other materials

subj:01015001.name: plastic art
subj:01015001.description: Forms of hand created art including installations

subj:01016001.name: soap opera
subj:01016001.description: Episodic TV drama or saga, normally aired during daytime

subj:01017000.name: theatre
subj:01017000.description: Telling of a story or idea through dialogue, music and physical expression in a space or building designed for it

subj:01018000.name: monument and heritage site
subj:01018000.description: Areas containing commemorative objects for historical people or events

subj:01019000.name: customs and tradition
subj:01019000.description: A particular way of behaving, or observances that have developed over time by a group of people

subj:01020000.name: arts (general)
subj:01020000.description: The collective expression of message or emotion through music, literature, painting, theatre or other means

subj:01021000.name: entertainment (general)
subj:01021000.description: The collective use of television, radio, theatre, music and the like for the amusement of people

subj:01021001.name: entertainment award
subj:01021001.description: Awards for achievement in the entertainment industry, such as the Oscars for film, the Booker Prize for Literature, the Grammys for music, or induction into halls of fame.

subj:01022000.name: culture (general)
subj:01022000.description: The ideas, customs, arts, skills of a particular group

subj:01022001.name: cultural development
subj:01022001.description: The history of the development of art and culture such as the rise of cave paintings, pre-Colombian art, Chinese paper-making, anything non-political

subj:01023000.name: nightclub
subj:01023000.description: A commercial establishment providing music, or other entertainment along with food and drink to selected clientele

subj:01024000.name: cartoon
subj:01024000.description: Still images such as editorial cartoons and comic strips

subj:01025000.name: animation
subj:01025000.description: Animation, including full-length and short cinema, artists and merchandising of goods featuring animation characters.

subj:01026001.name: periodicals
subj:01026001.description: Written material that is usually published weekly, bi-weekly, monthly or annually for a long time

subj:01026002.name: news media
subj:01026002.description: Television, wire services, radio that collect facts about incidents, developing and presenting them to audiences as a whole story

subj:01026003.name: newspapers
subj:01026003.description: Daily or weekly publications that present the day to day history of the world, as well as features, comics etc

subj:01026004.name: reviews
subj:01026004.description: A critical look at someone else's work, whether film, theatre or writing

subj:01028000.name: history
subj:01028000.description: Issues connected with the past; discoveries, repair, conservation or display of artifacts; anniversaries of historic events

subj:02000000.name: crime, law and justice
subj:02000000.description: Establishment and/or statement of the rules of behaviour in society, the enforcement of these rules, breaches of the rules and the punishment of offenders. Organizations and bodies involved in these activities.

subj:02001000.name: crime
subj:02001000.description: Violation of established laws by individuals, companies or organizations

subj:02001001.name: homicide
subj:02001001.description: Killing of one person by another

subj:02001002.name: computer crime
subj:02001002.description: Theft or destructive behaviour using a computer

subj:02001004.name: drug trafficking
subj:02001004.description: Dealing in illicit often harmful substances

subj:02001005.name: sexual assault
subj:02001005.description: Sexual battery of one sex against another

subj:02001006.name: assault (general)
subj:02001006.description: Battery, slugfests, brawls and threatening behaviour

subj:02001007.name: kidnapping
subj:02001007.description: To seize and detain or carry away a person against that person's will by unlawful threat, force or fraud

subj:02001008.name: arson
subj:02001008.description: Intentional setting of fires with criminal intent

subj:02001009.name: gang activity
subj:02001009.description: Criminal activities by groups of individuals, usually in urban areas, who are allied by common territories, languages, ethnic backgrounds but generally are loosely organized.

subj:02001010.name: terrorism
subj:02001010.description: Violence against people to create fear in order to achieve political or ideological objectives

subj:02002000.name: judiciary (system of justice)
subj:02002000.description: The system set up to deal with crime and those who do them

subj:02002001.name: lawyer
subj:02002001.description: Anyone legally able to represent another person or entity in a legal matter, such as a lawyer, solicitor, barrister, procurator, notary.

subj:02002002.name: judge
subj:02002002.description: Members of the bench that sit in judgement

subj:02003000.name: police
subj:02003000.description: Agents of the legal system set up enforce the laws

subj:02003001.name: law enforcement
subj:02003001.description: Agencies involved in attempts to prevent disobedience to established laws, or to bring to justice those that disobey those laws

subj:02003002.name: investigation
subj:02003002.description: Process of inquiry of a possible crime up to the point of arrest

subj:02003003.name: arrest
subj:02003003.description: Detention of a suspect of a crime

subj:02004000.name: punishment
subj:02004000.description: The retribution handed out to those who break the laws

subj:02004002.name: execution
subj:02004002.description: The carrying out of executions by a government or state, not by extralegal groups/organisations

subj:02005000.name: prison
subj:02005000.description: Also know as jails, lockups, calaboose, etc. for keeping law breakers from society

subj:02006000.name: laws
subj:02006000.description: The codification of rules of behaviour

subj:02007000.name: justice and rights
subj:02007000.description: The equitable administration of laws and regulations

subj:02007001.name: civil rights
subj:02007001.description: Rights of individuals under civil law

subj:02008000.name: trials
subj:02008000.description: The process by which guilt or innocence, or right or wrong is determined and adjudged

subj:02008001.name: litigation
subj:02008001.description: Taking disputed issues to court for settlement by judge and/or jury

subj:02008002.name: arbitration
subj:02008002.description: Resolution of disputed issues by a neutral panel

subj:02008003.name: court preliminary
subj:02008003.description: Pre-trial events including pleas, bail, motions, discovery, depositions.

subj:02009000.name: prosecution
subj:02009000.description: Stories regarding activities and investigations by public prosecutors.

subj:02010000.name: organized crime
subj:02010000.description: Crimes committed by gangs or criminal groups.

subj:02011000.name: international law
subj:02011000.description: The system of laws embraced by all nations, such as the Geneva Convention, the International Law of the Seas, etc.

subj:02011001.name: international court or tribunal
subj:02011001.description: The activities of international tribunals such as European court for human rights, Hague tribunal, International Court of Justice etc

subj:02011002.name: extradition
subj:02011002.description: Legal transfer of criminals or suspects between countries

subj:02012000.name: corporate crime
subj:02012000.description: Misdeeds of corporations and corporate officers

subj:02012001.name: fraud
subj:02012001.description: Intentional deception that causes others to give up rights or property

subj:02012002.name: embezzlement
subj:02012002.description: The intentional theft of money left in one's care

subj:02012003.name: restraint of trade
subj:02012003.description: Interference in free competition in business and trade

subj:02012004.name: breach of contract
subj:02012004.description: Rupture of legal agreements between companies, and with customers

subj:02012007.name: bribery
subj:02012007.description: Payments or benefits to influence the outcome of a legal case

subj:02013000.name: war crime
subj:02013000.description: Crimes committed during a war or armed conflict, usually against civilians or POW's, including the prosecution of such crimes

subj:02014000.name: inquest
subj:02014000.description: Formal investigation of sudden or unexpected death and the hearing to decide cause of death.

subj:02015000.name: inquiry
subj:02015000.description: Formal hearing involving a disaster, political event etc. Eg rail crash, drug prescription scandal.

subj:02016000.name: tribunal
subj:02016000.description: Formal hearing usually involving employment issues, property etc.

subj:03000000.name: disaster and accident
subj:03000000.description: Man made and natural events resulting in loss of life or injury to living creatures and/or damage to inanimate objects or property.

subj:03001000.name: drought
subj:03001000.description: A severe lack of water over a period of time

subj:03002000.name: earthquake
subj:03002000.description: The shifting of the tectonic plates of the Earth, creating in some cases damage to structures

subj:03003000.name: famine
subj:03003000.description: Severe lack of food for a large population

subj:03004000.name: fire
subj:03004000.description: Ignition and consumption of materials through a combination of high heat and oxygen

subj:03005000.name: flood
subj:03005000.description: Surfeit of water, caused by heavy rains or melting snow, usually in places where it's not wanted

subj:03006000.name: industrial accident
subj:03006000.description: A mishap in a factory, a shop or an office, potentially harmful to humans

subj:03006001.name: structural failures
subj:03006001.description: When a building, bridge or other structures collapse because of unexpected forces or poor design

subj:03007001.name: windstorms
subj:03007001.description: A storm of high velocity but non-hurricane force movements of air with little or no rain or hail. Often highly destructive

subj:03009000.name: pollution
subj:03009000.description: Emissions of unwanted materials in areas where it can be harmful

subj:03010000.name: transport accident
subj:03010000.description: An accident involving one or more vehicles

subj:03010003.name: air and space accident
subj:03010003.description: Accidents involving craft in air or space.

subj:03011000.name: volcanic eruption
subj:03011000.description: A rupture in the skin of the Earth allowing molten material to escape to the surface

subj:03012000.name: relief and aid organisation
subj:03012000.description: Organizations set up to provide help to those in need because of lack of food, water or shelter

subj:03013000.name: accident (general)
subj:03013000.description: Any unplanned event that causes unwanted consequences

subj:03014000.name: emergency incident
subj:03014000.description: A sudden, unexpected event that requires immediate action

subj:03014001.name: explosion
subj:03014001.description: Sudden eruptions, usually of chemical substances

subj:03015001.name: natural disasters
subj:03015001.description: Destructive incidents caused by the very nature of nature -- hurricanes, earthquakes, floods etc

subj:03015002.name: avalanche/landslide
subj:03015002.description: Sudden dislodging of massive amounts of snow or soil.

subj:03016000.name: emergency planning
subj:03016000.description: Planning for actions to deal with sudden, unplanned events

subj:03017000.name: rescue
subj:03017000.description: An operation to save people, animals or property from harm or danger.

subj:04000000.name: economy, business and finance
subj:04000000.description: All matters concerning the planning, production and exchange of wealth.

subj:04001000.name: agriculture
subj:04001000.description: The process of producing natural materials for consumption

subj:04001001.name: arable farming
subj:04001001.description: Production of food in the ground

subj:04001003.name: forestry and timber
subj:04001003.description: Production and collection and preparation of wood products for future use

subj:04001005.name: viniculture
subj:04001005.description: Production of wines from the vines to the finish products

subj:04001006.name: aquaculture
subj:04001006.description: Growing plants or animals in water for human consumption

subj:04002000.name: chemicals
subj:04002000.description: Natural or manmade materials used to produce other materials

subj:04002001.name: biotechnology
subj:04002001.description: The business of using engineering technology to study and solved problems of living organisms

subj:04002002.name: fertiliser
subj:04002002.description: Natural or manmade materials used to encourage the growth of plants

subj:04002003.name: health and beauty product
subj:04002003.description: Compilation of chemicals and other substances for use in enhancing ones looks or smell

subj:04002004.name: inorganic chemical
subj:04002004.description: The branch of chemistry dealing with minerals and metals

subj:04002005.name: organic chemical
subj:04002005.description: The branch of chemistry dealing with human, animal or carbon-based substances

subj:04002006.name: pharmaceutical
subj:04002006.description: The production of medicines from various chemicals and natural substances

subj:04002007.name: synthetic and plastic
subj:04002007.description: Chemicals used to produce plastics and other artificial substances to be used in manufacturing

subj:04003000.name: computing and information technology
subj:04003000.description: Anything to do with the computing and/or transmission of information from one point to another.

subj:04003001.name: hardware
subj:04003001.description: The physical devices used to provide computer services, such as monitors, hard drives, keyboards etc. but can also be used for equipment such as routers, servers and other network devices.

subj:04003002.name: networking
subj:04003002.description: The interconnectivity between hardware that provides the medium for the transmission of data.

subj:04003003.name: satellite technology
subj:04003003.description: Hardware and software that enables groundbased devices to send signals to each other via an orbiting satellite.

subj:04003004.name: semiconductors and active components
subj:04003004.description: The basic components that together create working electronic devices such as computers

subj:04003005.name: software
subj:04003005.description: Programming sets that, when installed on hardware, perform specified functions.

subj:04003006.name: telecommunication equipment
subj:04003006.description: Devices such as telephone sets, voice/data switches, modems etc that facilitate point-to-point voice/data transmissions

subj:04003007.name: telecommunication service
subj:04003007.description: Services provided by commercial companies that facilitate connections between telephones, pagers, computers

subj:04003008.name: security
subj:04003008.description: To encompass technical developments in hardware and software, basic research and related areas such as cyber security

subj:04003009.name: wireless technology
subj:04003009.description: Transmission of information through means other than point-to-point wired hookups

subj:04004000.name: construction and property
subj:04004000.description: All items pertaining to the construction and sale of property

subj:04004001.name: heavy construction
subj:04004001.description: Large scale construction projects, construction of roads, dams, office/factory buildings, offshore and onshore structures, large sport stadiums

subj:04004002.name: house building
subj:04004002.description: Construction of residences, for private use

subj:04004003.name: real estate
subj:04004003.description: The buying and selling of properties of all types

subj:04004004.name: farms
subj:04004004.description: Agricultural areas for the production of foodstuffs, including dairy products, fruits and livestock, such as cattle and fish

subj:04004005.name: land price
subj:04004005.description: The price of land in specific zoned areas such as commercial, residential arable as provided by a responsible body

subj:04004006.name: renovation
subj:04004006.description: Restoring properties/structures to a former better state by cleaning, repairing or rebuilding.

subj:04004007.name: design and engineering
subj:04004007.description: Design and planning by Engineers, Architects etc. of roads, offices, factories, dams , offshore structures,

subj:04005000.name: energy and resource
subj:04005000.description: Production of electrical power, and the water, air, sunlight, and fuels used to produce them

subj:04005002.name: coal
subj:04005002.description: Production and mining of anthracite and bituminous products for use in power production

subj:04005003.name: oil and gas - downstream activities
subj:04005003.description: All matters concerning oil and gas, typically refining and distribution activities

subj:04005004.name: oil and gas - upstream activities
subj:04005004.description: All matters concerning oil and gas, typically supply chain activities from the reservoir to the refinery gate

subj:04005005.name: nuclear power
subj:04005005.description: Use of radioactive materials for power production

subj:04005006.name: electricity production and distribution
subj:04005006.description: Primarily concerning the power line distribution system, but also the sale of electrical power at wholesale and retail levels

subj:04005007.name: waste management and pollution control
subj:04005007.description: The business of waste management and pollution control

subj:04005008.name: water supply
subj:04005008.description: The business of providing water for human use

subj:04005009.name: natural resources (general)
subj:04005009.description: The general use of natural resources for business purposes, not focused on specific resources such as coal, oil, gas or water

subj:04005010.name: energy (general)
subj:04005010.description: Energy industry, not focused on any specific sector

subj:04005011.name: natural gas
subj:04005011.description: A natural resource, mainly methane in an flammable gaseous state, from the ground

subj:04005012.name: petrol
subj:04005012.description: Distilled petroleum product used for automotive fuel, with or without additives

subj:04005013.name: diesel fuel
subj:04005013.description: A distilled petroleum product heavier than gasoline used not only for trucks, marine engines, but in certain forms for home heating

subj:04005014.name: kerosene/paraffin
subj:04005014.description: A light petroleum distillate used for cooking fuel, aircraft jet engines, lamps, heating and cleaning

subj:04006000.name: financial and business service
subj:04006000.description: Services that transmit, safeguard, keep track of money or provide backup to commercial enterprises

subj:04006001.name: accountancy and auditing
subj:04006001.description: Services provide balance sheet, budgets reconciliation and examine accuracy of financial statements

subj:04006002.name: banking
subj:04006002.description: Services for storing, transmitting, receiving and delivery of cash moneys

subj:04006003.name: consultancy service
subj:04006003.description: Providers of expert knowledge in a wide range of fields usually on a temporary, contract basis

subj:04006004.name: employment agency
subj:04006004.description: A service helping people find jobs, and companies to find workers

subj:04006005.name: healthcare provider
subj:04006005.description: Providers of medical services at all levels, including doctors, hospitals etc

subj:04006006.name: insurance
subj:04006006.description: A risk taking venture that allows individuals to pay small amounts periodically to guard financially against unexpected events

subj:04006007.name: legal service
subj:04006007.description: Lawyers and others who help companies and individuals deal with state, federal and local laws

subj:04006008.name: market research
subj:04006008.description: A service that tries to determine what people want to buy

subj:04006009.name: stock broking
subj:04006009.description: The buying and selling of company shares on behalf of individuals or other entities

subj:04006012.name: shipping service
subj:04006012.description: Companies that prepare and transport packages and documents for individuals or companies by any means, including postal services.

subj:04006013.name: personal service
subj:04006013.description: Consumer service that is intangible e.g. beauty care as in hairdressing

subj:04006014.name: janitorial service
subj:04006014.description: Companies that provide cleaning and similar services for homes and businesses.

subj:04006015.name: funeral parlour and crematorium
subj:04006015.description: Companies that provide services for disposal of the dead

subj:04006016.name: rental service
subj:04006016.description: Companies which provide rentals, including motor vehicles, tuxedos, tools, heavy equipment, and other supplies

subj:04006017.name: wedding service
subj:04006017.description: Services and products related to the wedding industry

subj:04006019.name: personal income
subj:04006019.description: Money that a person earns and is his/hers to keep or spend

subj:04006021.name: printing/promotional service
subj:04006021.description: Production of printed matter such as flyers, ads, signs etc

subj:04006022.name: investment service
subj:04006022.description: Financial advisers, as opposed to stock dealers or consultants

subj:04007000.name: consumer goods
subj:04007000.description: Items produced for and sold to individuals

subj:04007002.name: department store
subj:04007002.description: Stores largely devoted to the sale of clothing to individuals

subj:04007003.name: food
subj:04007003.description: Fruits, vegetables, breads, meats for human consumption

subj:04007004.name: mail order
subj:04007004.description: Items sold through and delivered by mail

subj:04007005.name: retail
subj:04007005.description: The last stage in the sales chain

subj:04007006.name: speciality store
subj:04007006.description: Retail outlets that specialize in categories such as shoes, coats, power tools, etc

subj:04007007.name: wholesale
subj:04007007.description: The first link in the sales chain after production

subj:04007008.name: beverage
subj:04007008.description: Liquid consumables, both alcoholic and non-alcoholic

subj:04007009.name: electronic commerce
subj:04007009.description: Buying and selling items through the Internet

subj:04007010.name: luxury good
subj:04007010.description: Leather bags, jewellery, haute couture, accessories etc

subj:04007011.name: non-durable good
subj:04007011.description: Lighters, pens and stationery, tableware, watches, glasses etc

subj:04008000.name: macro economics
subj:04008000.description: Broad scale economics and the world or national level

subj:04008001.name: central bank
subj:04008001.description: A country's major bank that sets interest rates, and provides transfer of funds between commercial banks

subj:04008002.name: consumer issue
subj:04008002.description: Those issues, such as prices, inflation/deflation, quality of goods, at the retail sales level

subj:04008003.name: debt market
subj:04008003.description: Market for trading debt instruments such as bonds, CDs, bankers acceptances, T bills, notes, IOUs etc

subj:04008004.name: economic indicator
subj:04008004.description: Certain indexes, such as company inventories, the movement of prices that show whether the economy is improving or declining

subj:04008005.name: emerging market
subj:04008005.description: Those markets that are struggling to enter the world economies and those requiring financial help from international lenders

subj:04008006.name: foreign exchange market
subj:04008006.description: The trading of shekels, dinars, euros dollars etc around the world through regulated markets

subj:04008007.name: government aid
subj:04008007.description: Supply of financial and other help by one government, usually to another

subj:04008008.name: government debt
subj:04008008.description: The amount a government owes on bonds, services and for goods and services for which it has no ready cash

subj:04008009.name: interest rate
subj:04008009.description: The amount of money one must pay to borrow money

subj:04008010.name: international economic institution
subj:04008010.description: Entities such as UNIDO, World Bank, World Trade Organization, the Import-Expert Bank etc that deals at a world level

subj:04008011.name: international (foreign) trade
subj:04008011.description: Trade of goods and services between nations

subj:04008012.name: loan market
subj:04008012.description: The market where money is available to borrow, at certain rates of interest

subj:04008013.name: economic organization
subj:04008013.description: Business, industrial and trade associations, societies and other private-sector groups.

subj:04008014.name: consumer confidence
subj:04008014.description: Reports on consumer confidence in the economy.

subj:04008015.name: trade dispute
subj:04008015.description: International dispute over trade barriers, cartels, dumping etc.

subj:04008016.name: inflation and deflation
subj:04008016.description: An increase in the amount of money in circulation and thereby a rise in prices; deflation, tighter monetary policy causing lower prices

subj:04008017.name: prices
subj:04008017.description: The monetary value of goods, services or stocks and bonds

subj:04008018.name: currency values
subj:04008018.description: The value of one currency as measured against another

subj:04008019.name: budgets and budgeting
subj:04008019.description: A method of balancing revenues against expenses

subj:04008020.name: credit and debt
subj:04008020.description: Credit: the amount of money available to you, often by loan. Debt, the amount you owe.

subj:04008021.name: loans
subj:04008021.description: An agreement by one individual or institution to temporarily disperse money to another, with an agreed rate and time for its return

subj:04008022.name: mortgages
subj:04008022.description: The loan of money for the purpose of purchasing a property, whether land or building. Or, for homeowners to repair or maintain properties, often based on owner equity in a property

subj:04008023.name: financial markets
subj:04008023.description: Institutions set up to trade the shares or other financial paper of companies or other organizations, can also include currency trading

subj:04008024.name: commodity markets
subj:04008024.description: The bartering or trading of goods such as cotton, oil, coal, metals, etc

subj:04008025.name: investments
subj:04008025.description: Speculative purchases of corporate instruments, of commodities, currencies, or parts thereof

subj:04008026.name: stocks
subj:04008026.description: Corporate paper that gives an individual an ownership right to a part of a company's earnings

subj:04008027.name: bonds
subj:04008027.description: Corporate or governmental paper representing the loan of money at a fixed rate and for a fixed time to that company or government

subj:04008028.name: mutual funds
subj:04008028.description: Pools of shares or bonds for sale often grouped by investment intention, such as growth, income or security

subj:04008029.name: derivative securities
subj:04008029.description: Financial instruments such as futures, swaps and options, used for risk management, whose characteristics and value depend upon the characteristics and value of an underlying instrument, such as a commodity, bond, equity or currency.

subj:04008030.name: imports
subj:04008030.description: What is bought abroad and brought into a country for resale

subj:04008031.name: exports
subj:04008031.description: What is produced or manufactured in your country and sent and sold elsewhere

subj:04008032.name: trade agreements
subj:04008032.description: Government level agreements between countries for the sale and purchase of goods and services

subj:04008033.name: trade policy
subj:04008033.description: Governmental decisions on tariffs, shipping, embargoes, and the types or kinds of goods and services to be imported and exported

subj:04008034.name: business enterprises
subj:04008034.description: Organizations set up usually for profit-making purposes by creating and selling a product or service

subj:04008035.name: tariff
subj:04008035.description: Fees placed on goods imported or exported, often punitive

subj:04008036.name: trade balance
subj:04008036.description: The difference between the financial value of imports and exports

subj:04009000.name: market and exchange
subj:04009000.description: Organized entities for buying and selling stocks, currencies, commodities and other goods

subj:04009001.name: energy
subj:04009001.description: Stories related to energy trading and markets

subj:04009002.name: metal
subj:04009002.description: Markets for trading base metals such as copper, aluminium, steel, zinc etc

subj:04009003.name: securities
subj:04009003.description: Markets for trading types of company paper such as stocks and bonds

subj:04009004.name: soft commodity
subj:04009004.description: Trading in commodities such as cotton, sugar, sorghum, soybeans etc.

subj:04010000.name: media
subj:04010000.description: The various means of disseminating news and information to the public

subj:04010001.name: advertising
subj:04010001.description: Methods of promoting goods and service to consumers through video, graphics, print text etc

subj:04010002.name: book
subj:04010002.description: The business of producing and selling bound media, whether fiction or non-fiction

subj:04010004.name: news agency
subj:04010004.description: Commercial agencies for production and distribution of newsworthy events through print, broadcast, video or electronic media

subj:04010005.name: newspaper and magazine
subj:04010005.description: The business of producing bound and unbound printed paper products for periodic distribution of news items

subj:04010006.name: online
subj:04010006.description: The business of distributing news and information through computer networks for public consumption

subj:04010007.name: public relation
subj:04010007.description: The job of promoting products and services through advertising campaigns and/or through person-to-person contact or through news releases

subj:04010009.name: satellite and cable service
subj:04010009.description: The business of transmitting of news, entertainment and information via satellite or cable television services

subj:04011000.name: manufacturing and engineering
subj:04011000.description: Manufacturers of electrical, electronic and mechanical equipment but does not cover civil engineering.

subj:04011001.name: aerospace
subj:04011001.description: Companies that assemble or manufacture components for airplanes and space ships.

subj:04011002.name: automotive equipment
subj:04011002.description: Companies that produce components for automobiles

subj:04011003.name: defence equipment
subj:04011003.description: Manufacturers of guns, tanks, cannons, ships etc for the military and non-military protection services

subj:04011004.name: electrical appliance
subj:04011004.description: Makers of large and small electrical goods for use in homes or business

subj:04011005.name: heavy engineering
subj:04011005.description: Manufacturers of cranes, bulldozers and the like for use in major construction projects

subj:04011006.name: industrial component
subj:04011006.description: Manufacturers of mechanical, electrical, electronic items needed in the manufacture of other items

subj:04011007.name: instrument engineering
subj:04011007.description: Manufacturers of instruments for calibration, measurement of things like speed, pressure, distance

subj:04011009.name: machine manufacturing
subj:04011009.description: Manufacturers of turbines, engines, fans , pumps , motors and components for powered equipment.

subj:04012000.name: metal and mineral
subj:04012000.description: Production and refining of ores into metals

subj:04012001.name: building material
subj:04012001.description: Manufacture of materials like wallboard, lumber wiring for the building industry

subj:04012002.name: gold and precious material
subj:04012002.description: Mining, refining and sales of gold and other precious metals

subj:04012003.name: iron and steel
subj:04012003.description: Mining, refining and sales of iron-based metals

subj:04012004.name: non ferrous metal
subj:04012004.description: Mining, refining and sales of copper, zinc, aluminium, and other metals not based on iron

subj:04012005.name: mining
subj:04012005.description: The industry of digging for metals, raw materials such as coal, or precious gems such as diamonds

subj:04013000.name: process industry
subj:04013000.description: The business of turning raw materials into useable products

subj:04013002.name: food
subj:04013002.description: The business of processing, distributing and selling for basic human consumption

subj:04013003.name: furnishings and furniture
subj:04013003.description: Manufacture of furniture, wallpaper, paints and fabrics for interior decoration

subj:04013004.name: paper and packaging product
subj:04013004.description: Production of paper material for writing, wrapping, printing, or packaging

subj:04013005.name: rubber product
subj:04013005.description: Production of rubber based materials for gloves, protective coatings, hoses and the like

subj:04013007.name: textile and clothing
subj:04013007.description: Production of fabrics for furnishings and fixtures, and for clothing of various types

subj:04013008.name: tobacco
subj:04013008.description: Growing, producing and sale of tobacco products

subj:04014001.name: casino and gambling
subj:04014001.description: The business of providing outlets for various games of chance using cards, dice, spinning wheels to betting on animal races

subj:04014002.name: hotel and accommodation
subj:04014002.description: The business of providing food and shelter to travellers

subj:04014003.name: recreational and sporting goods
subj:04014003.description: Manufacture of goods for leisure activities

subj:04014004.name: restaurant and catering
subj:04014004.description: The business of providing prepared foods for customers in groups large and small

subj:04014005.name: tour operator
subj:04014005.description: Operators of trips either locally, as around town, or to other countries

subj:04015000.name: transport
subj:04015000.description: The means of getting from one place to the other without walking

subj:04015002.name: railway
subj:04015002.description: The business of transporting people or cargo by rail

subj:04015003.name: road transport
subj:04015003.description: The business of transport goods by trucks and highways

subj:04015004.name: waterway and maritime transport
subj:04015004.description: Commercial movement of people or goods via boats, ships and water

subj:04016000.name: company information
subj:04016000.description: Information about individual companies or business entities

subj:04016001.name: accounting and audit
subj:04016001.description: Changes in choice of auditing firm. Reports on impact of changes in GAAP.

subj:04016002.name: annual and special corporate meeting
subj:04016002.description: Announcements of upcoming meetings. Reports on meetings.

subj:04016003.name: annual report
subj:04016003.description: Availability or contents of annual company reports.

subj:04016005.name: merger, acquisition and takeover
subj:04016005.description: News on mergers, takeovers or acquisitions.

subj:04016006.name: analysts' comment
subj:04016006.description: Stock analyst comments, analysis and recommendations.

subj:04016008.name: board of directors (appointment and change)
subj:04016008.description: Appointments to or changes in the board of directors for a company.

subj:04016009.name: buyback
subj:04016009.description: Stock buyback programs. This should be kept distinct from Stock Activity (see below).

subj:04016011.name: corporate officer
subj:04016011.description: Appointments or changes in corporate officers.

subj:04016014.name: defence contract
subj:04016014.description: The award of government contracts for defence related activity.

subj:04016015.name: dividend announcement
subj:04016015.description: Announcements regarding the disbursement of dividends.

subj:04016017.name: financially distressed company
subj:04016017.description: Aa company is financially distressed - not yet having filed for bankruptcy.

subj:04016019.name: financing and stock offering
subj:04016019.description: New offerings of equity including initial public offerings.

subj:04016020.name: government contract
subj:04016020.description: The award of government contracts not related to defence activity

subj:04016021.name: global expansion
subj:04016021.description: Planned or actual openings of offices in countries for the first time.

subj:04016022.name: insider trading
subj:04016022.description: The purchase or sales of stock by corporate officers or board members.

subj:04016023.name: joint venture
subj:04016023.description: Joint ventures between companies. (Not marketing related - see Marketing.)

subj:04016025.name: layoffs and downsizing
subj:04016025.description: Planned or actual reductions in the labour force.

subj:04016027.name: litigation and regulation
subj:04016027.description: Corporate law including litigation and regulations.

subj:04016028.name: management change
subj:04016028.description: Major appointments or changes in management below the level of corporate officer.

subj:04016029.name: marketing
subj:04016029.description: Includes news regarding joint marketing agreements between companies, adoption of new product marketing strategies, etc.

subj:04016031.name: patent, copyright and trademark
subj:04016031.description: News related to patents, copyright and trademarks.

subj:04016032.name: plant closing
subj:04016032.description: Announcements of planned or actual plant closings.

subj:04016033.name: plant opening
subj:04016033.description: Announcements of planned or actual plant openings.

subj:04016035.name: proxy filing
subj:04016035.description: Filings with regulatory agencies of proxy statements for upcoming shareholder votes.

subj:04016036.name: rating
subj:04016036.description: Corporate and sovereign debt and credit ratings (e.g. SandP or Moody's)

subj:04016037.name: research and development
subj:04016037.description: Research and expenditure on new product development.

subj:04016038.name: quarterly or semiannual financial statement
subj:04016038.description: Availability or contents of quarterly or semi-annual corporate reports.

subj:04016039.name: restructuring and recapitalisation
subj:04016039.description: Sale of company units, splits of existing companies into units under a holding company, etc.

subj:04016040.name: spin-off
subj:04016040.description: Creation of new companies being spun off from existing companies.

subj:04016041.name: stock activity
subj:04016041.description: Announcements of major stock events: splits, block trades, new highs or lows, etc.

subj:04016042.name: industrial production
subj:04016042.description: Manufacture of durable and non-durable goods

subj:04016043.name: productivity
subj:04016043.description: The cost of labour to produce an item of value, often measured as output per hour per person

subj:04016044.name: inventories
subj:04016044.description: Goods not sold and held by the producer, wholesaler or retailer

subj:04016045.name: sales
subj:04016045.description: Either the exchange of goods for money, or the practice of discounting prices to increase the amount of goods sold, or to get rid of outdated merchandise

subj:04016046.name: corporations
subj:04016046.description: Business enterprises formally licensed with boards of directors and hierarchical structures of governance

subj:04016047.name: shareholders
subj:04016047.description: Anyone holding a piece of paper issued by a company which changes in value and entitles them to dividends depending on the performance of the company

subj:04016048.name: corporate performance
subj:04016048.description: How well a company performs, measured by its net earnings, its dividends its earnings per share and price/earnings ratio

subj:04016050.name: credit ratings
subj:04016050.description: Formal statements by certain rating agencies such as Standard and Poor's on the investment risk of a company, a country or enterprise

subj:04016051.name: stock splits
subj:04016051.description: Issuing multiple shares for one share of stock. Usually occurs when the price of a stock has increased so much that its purchase price is not attractive. A reverse split is when one share is issued for multiple shares, to raise the per share value.

subj:04016052.name: stock options
subj:04016052.description: An agreement to either buy or sell a stock when it meets a certain price

subj:04016053.name: recalls (products)
subj:04016053.description: A decision by a company to take back or repair a defective product

subj:04016056.name: purchase
subj:04016056.description: Items that companies buy, such as raw materials, office supplies etc.

subj:04016057.name: new service
subj:04016057.description: New services added by a company, such as new flight routes, etc.

subj:04017000.name: economy (general)
subj:04017000.description: Content of a general nature about trade and the economy

subj:04017001.name: economic policy
subj:04017001.description: Government directed policy on production, taxes, tariffs and things that affect the direction and health of the economy

subj:04018000.name: business (general)
subj:04018000.description: Content of a general nature about business

subj:04018001.name: institution
subj:04018001.description: Either an established law, practice or system or an organization having a social, religious, educational or similar purpose such as hospital, school, prison

subj:04019000.name: finance (general)
subj:04019000.description: Content of a general nature about finance

subj:04019001.name: money and monetary policy
subj:04019001.description: Government bank directed policy on the amount of money in circulation and the rate at which it can be loaned

subj:05000000.name: education
subj:05000000.description: All aspects of furthering knowledge of human individuals from birth to death.

subj:05001000.name: adult education
subj:05001000.description: Education provided for older students outside the usual age groups of 5-25

subj:05002000.name: further education
subj:05002000.description: Any form of education beyond basic education of several levels

subj:05003000.name: parent organisation
subj:05003000.description: Groups of parents set up to support schools

subj:05004000.name: preschool
subj:05004000.description: Education for children under the national compulsory education age

subj:05005000.name: school
subj:05005000.description: A building or institution in which education of various sorts is provided

subj:05005001.name: elementary schools
subj:05005001.description: Schools usually of a level from kindergarten through 11 or 12 years of age

subj:05005002.name: middle schools
subj:05005002.description: Transitional school between elementary and high school, 12 through 13 years of age

subj:05005003.name: high schools
subj:05005003.description: Pre-college/ university level education, 14 to 17 or 18 years of age, called freshman, sophomore, junior and senior

subj:05006000.name: teachers union
subj:05006000.description: Organization of teachers for collective bargaining and other purposes

subj:05007000.name: university
subj:05007000.description: Institutions of higher learning capable of providing doctorate degrees

subj:05008000.name: upbringing
subj:05008000.description: Lessons learned from parents and others as one grows up

subj:05009000.name: entrance examination
subj:05009000.description: Exams for entering colleges, universities, junior and senior high schools, and all other higher and lower education institutes, including cram schools, which help students prepare for exams for entry to prestigious schools.

subj:05010000.name: teaching and learning
subj:05010000.description: Either end of the education equation

subj:05010001.name: students
subj:05010001.description: People of any age in a structured environment, not necessarily a classroom, in order to learn something

subj:05010002.name: teachers
subj:05010002.description: People with knowledge who can impart that knowledge to others

subj:05010003.name: curriculum
subj:05010003.description: The courses offered by a learning institution and the regulation of those courses

subj:05011000.name: religious education
subj:05011000.description: Instruction by any faith, in that faith or about other faiths, usually, but not always, conducted in schools run by religious bodies

subj:05011001.name: parochial school
subj:05011001.description: A school run by the Roman Catholic faith

subj:05011002.name: seminary
subj:05011002.description: A school of any faith specifically designed to train ministers

subj:06000000.name: environmental issue
subj:06000000.description: All aspects of protection, damage, and condition of the ecosystem of the planet earth and its surroundings.

subj:06001000.name: renewable energy
subj:06001000.description: Environmental impact of renewable energy, including solar, wind, hydro, biomass and geothermal

subj:06002000.name: conservation
subj:06002000.description: Preservation of wilderness areas, flora and fauna, including species extinction

subj:06002001.name: endangered species
subj:06002001.description: Those species of wildlife in danger of disappearing, largely because of changes in environment, hunting, or weather

subj:06002002.name: ecosystem
subj:06002002.description: A system of plants, animals and bacteria interrelated in its physical/chemical environment

subj:06003000.name: energy saving
subj:06003000.description: Conservation of electrical, and other power sources

subj:06005000.name: environmental pollution
subj:06005000.description: Corruption of air, water, land etc. by harmful substances

subj:06005001.name: air pollution
subj:06005001.description: Solid or gaseous matter affecting the quality of air that we breathe

subj:06005002.name: water pollution
subj:06005002.description: Solids or liquids that corrupt the quality of water that could be used for drinking or irrigation

subj:06006000.name: natural resources
subj:06006000.description: Stories about the environmental issues related to the exploitation of natural resources for human use

subj:06006001.name: land resources
subj:06006001.description: That portion of a nation or state that is above water and available for development either for profit or for the general good of the public

subj:06006002.name: parks
subj:06006002.description: Areas set aside and developed for public enjoyment and recreation, including commercial development such as theme parks

subj:06006003.name: forests
subj:06006003.description: Open areas of trees either available for public enjoyment, or for commercial purposes

subj:06006004.name: wetlands
subj:06006004.description: Areas generally marshy and not either under water or dry land. Often related to aquifers for water quality and/or wildlife

subj:06006005.name: mountains
subj:06006005.description: Elevated land masses formed over the ages either by erosion, volcanic eruption, or movement of massive geographical formations called plates

subj:06006006.name: rivers
subj:06006006.description: Moving water areas bounded by land that extend from earth sources and meander through land areas to join with other water areas. In smaller forms they are creeks, rivulets, streams etc

subj:06006007.name: oceans
subj:06006007.description: Salt water masses separating continents or other major geographical masses. smaller forms are seas or lakes or ponds

subj:06006008.name: wildlife
subj:06006008.description: All forms of animal life that have not been domesticated

subj:06006009.name: energy resources
subj:06006009.description: Such resources as coal, gas, wind, sunlight etc., used to generate heat, electricity and power

subj:06007000.name: nature
subj:06007000.description: Taken as a whole the natural environment of flora and fauna

subj:06007001.name: invasive species
subj:06007001.description: Non-native plants, animals and other organisms that tend to take over native species

subj:06008000.name: population
subj:06008000.description: People and their growth and development within a natural setting

subj:06009000.name: waste
subj:06009000.description: Environmental impact of waste, including recycling efforts

subj:06010000.name: water
subj:06010000.description: Environmental issues about bodies of water, including oceans, lakes, streams and reservoirs, as well as ice, glaciers and forms of precipitation

subj:06011000.name: global warming
subj:06011000.description: All issues relating to global warming including temperature research, remote sensing on temperature trends, debate on global warming, ways to reduce emissions and carbon trading.

subj:06012000.name: hazardous materials
subj:06012000.description: Materials that are harmful to humans or animals if they are exposed to them. Includes radiation, poison gases, chemicals, heavy metals, PCBs, and certain plant products

subj:06013000.name: environmental cleanup
subj:06013000.description: Processes whereby contaminated areas are cleaned of hazardous materials so they can be inhabited again by either people or animals.

subj:07000000.name: health
subj:07000000.description: All aspects pertaining to the physical and mental welfare of human beings.

subj:07001001.name: communicable diseases
subj:07001001.description: Diseases that can be transmitted from one person or animal to another

subj:07001002.name: virus diseases
subj:07001002.description: Diseases caused by infection within cells by viruses

subj:07001003.name: AIDS
subj:07001003.description: Acquired Immunity Deficiency Syndrome, an incurable disease caused by the human immunodeficiency virus

subj:07001004.name: cancer
subj:07001004.description: A serious and often fatal disease caused when normal cells mutate into tumours

subj:07001005.name: heart disease
subj:07001005.description: A degenerative and serious disease caused by narrowing of the arteries feeding the heart

subj:07001006.name: alzheimer's disease
subj:07001006.description: A disorder of the brain leading to dementia

subj:07001007.name: animal diseases
subj:07001007.description: Disorders affecting animals that do not necessarily endanger humans

subj:07001008.name: plant diseases
subj:07001008.description: Disorders affecting plants caused either by parasites or environmental factors

subj:07001009.name: retrovirus
subj:07001009.description: A family of RNA viruses such as those causing leukaemia and AIDS

subj:07002000.name: epidemic and plague
subj:07002000.description: An epidemic is a rapidly spreading condition in a community and a plague is usually a deadly disease of epidemic proportions

subj:07003000.name: health treatment
subj:07003000.description: In general treatment of diseases and other conditions to produce wellness

subj:07003001.name: prescription drugs
subj:07003001.description: Drugs that can be purchased only with a doctor's authorization

subj:07003002.name: dietary supplements
subj:07003002.description: Nutrients taken in addition to food to bolster health

subj:07003004.name: medical procedure/test
subj:07003004.description: Any of a variety of treatments such as stress tests, catheterization, blood tests, computerised axial tomography scan or magnetic resonance imaging

subj:07003005.name: therapy
subj:07003005.description: Treatment of physical, mental or medical conditions by non-surgical means

subj:07004000.name: health organisations
subj:07004000.description: Includes stories about specific health organizations, including professional associations, non-profits and international groups

subj:07005000.name: medical research
subj:07005000.description: Investigation into the causes and cures of diseases

subj:07006000.name: medical staff
subj:07006000.description: Doctors, nurses, interns and others in a medical facility

subj:07006001.name: primary care physician
subj:07006001.description: Patient's basic health care doctor - first point of call for all health related problems

subj:07006002.name: health-workers union
subj:07006002.description: Issues involving industry groups for doctors, nurses, health workers etc.

subj:07007000.name: medicine
subj:07007000.description: A substance used with the expectation that it will eliminate disease or illness

subj:07007001.name: herbal
subj:07007001.description: Treatment based on the use of herbs and other plants to cure or alleviate disease symptoms

subj:07007002.name: holistic
subj:07007002.description: Treatment of the whole person including mental and social factors rather than just the symptoms of the disease.

subj:07007003.name: western
subj:07007003.description: The practice of diagnosis, treatment and prevention of disease based on modern scientific research in the western hemisphere.

subj:07007004.name: traditional Chinese
subj:07007004.description: The practice of diagnosis, treatment and prevention of disease based on traditional methods developed in the orient.

subj:07008000.name: preventative medicine
subj:07008000.description: Substances used to prevent diseases or illnesses

subj:07008001.name: vaccines
subj:07008001.description: Medications designed to create immunity to diseases

subj:07009000.name: injury
subj:07009000.description: A traumatic condition of the human body caused usually by outside forces

subj:07010000.name: hospital and clinic
subj:07010000.description: Medical facilities for the treatment of illnesses and injury

subj:07011000.name: government health care
subj:07011000.description: Health care provided by national governments

subj:07011001.name: medicare
subj:07011001.description: A program of the U.S. government to provide health care to senior citizens

subj:07011002.name: medicaid
subj:07011002.description: A program of the U.S. government to provide health care to needy citizens of all ages

subj:07012000.name: private health care
subj:07012000.description: Health care provided by privately funded or insured organizations

subj:07013000.name: healthcare policy
subj:07013000.description: Health-related policy decisions including what different countries are doing regarding prescription drug policies, AIDS, psychiatric care, health care funding and related topics.

subj:07013001.name: food safety
subj:07013001.description: Issues relating to food cleanliness and contamination

subj:07014001.name: geriatric
subj:07014001.description: Research into aging and age-related issues including age-related illnesses, medical research, trends, geriatric medicine and related topics like age discrimination and health insurance for an ageing population.

subj:07014002.name: pediatrics
subj:07014002.description: Research and medicine specifically for the young - includes premature babies, infant care, childhood disease and treatment - also teen-related health and behaviour problems.

subj:07014003.name: reproduction
subj:07014003.description: Reproductive technologies like invitro fertilization and cloning as well as related debates. Sexual development matters and sexually transmitted diseases would also fall under this category.

subj:07014004.name: genetics
subj:07014004.description: The science and research into genetic-base disease and cures for disease. This would include proteomics (the study of what proteins are produced by which genes and what those proteins do), general genetics and stem-cell research.

subj:07015000.name: medical service
subj:07015000.description: Medical support for doctors, including blood tests and other medical tests on individuals, X-rays CAT scans MRIs etc.

subj:07016000.name: physical fitness
subj:07016000.description: The condition of a person's cardio-vascular and muscular health.

subj:07017000.name: illness
subj:07017000.description: Non-specific maladies such as stomach aches, headaches, flat feet, lumbago

subj:07017002.name: eating disorder
subj:07017002.description: Anorexia, bulimia, overeating and similar illnesses

subj:07017003.name: obesity
subj:07017003.description: A condition of body weight generally considered 20 percent above the norm for gender, age, height and bone structure

subj:07018000.name: medical conditions
subj:07018000.description: Various stages of disease, illness or injury

subj:07019000.name: patient
subj:07019000.description: Issues which affect population in general as attendees at hospitals or doctors' surgeries.

subj:08000000.name: human interest
subj:08000000.description: Lighter items about individuals, groups, animals or objects.

subj:08002000.name: curiosity
subj:08002000.description: Content of an unusual nature that can raise questions or amuse

subj:08003000.name: people
subj:08003000.description: Unusual content about people of all levels

subj:08003001.name: advice
subj:08003001.description: Letters and answers about personal problems that are publishable

subj:08003002.name: celebrity
subj:08003002.description: Celebrity news, i.e. Madonna has a baby, Elton John sues his accountants etc.

subj:08003003.name: accomplishment
subj:08003003.description: Achievements by individuals or groups, such as charitable fundraising, winning a competitive contest etc

subj:08003004.name: human mishap
subj:08003004.description: Stories arising from silly/stupid human errors e.g. like forgetting to tie one end of a bungee cord

subj:08003005.name: fortune-telling
subj:08003005.description: The forecasting of future events or the delineation of character by methods not ordinarily considered to have a rational basis

subj:08005001.name: ceremony
subj:08005001.description: Rituals of a non-religious nature such as dedications, wreath layings, ship launchings etc

subj:08005002.name: death
subj:08005002.description: The human interest aspects of the demise of a person

subj:08005003.name: funeral
subj:08005003.description: The ceremony to intern the remains of a person

subj:08005004.name: estate bestowal
subj:08005004.description: The distribution of the estate of a person according to their will and any disagreements between the heirs

subj:08005005.name: memorial
subj:08005005.description: Commemorative ceremony or object - plaque, statue etc - in remembrance of a person.

subj:08006000.name: award and prize
subj:08006000.description: Decorations, awards and prizes, including those given by the government.

subj:08006001.name: record
subj:08006001.description: Non-sport achievement by an individual or group that sets a new record, such as most books read, holding your breath longest

subj:08007000.name: imperial and royal matters
subj:08007000.description: Imperial and royal family members, including matters on legal systems.

subj:08008000.name: plant
subj:08008000.description: An organism of the kind exemplified by trees, shrubs, grasses, ferns, and mosses, typically growing in a permanent site

subj:09000000.name: labour
subj:09000000.description: Social aspects, organizations, rules and conditions affecting the employment of human effort for the generation of wealth or provision of services and the economic support of the unemployed.

subj:09001000.name: apprentices
subj:09001000.description: People who are in the work force at a learning level, serving under a master

subj:09002000.name: collective contract
subj:09002000.description: Usually written contracts covering a specific class of worker

subj:09002001.name: contract issue-wages
subj:09002001.description: Element of contracts and contract discussions centring on remuneration

subj:09002002.name: contract issue-healthcare
subj:09002002.description: Element of contracts and contract discussions centring on health care issues

subj:09002003.name: contract issue-work rules
subj:09002003.description: Element of contracts and contract discussions centring on rules affecting issues such as lunch and other breaks, work shifts, vacation scheduling, seniority, sick leave etc.

subj:09003001.name: labor market
subj:09003001.description: A pool of people who are working or are seeking work

subj:09003002.name: job layoffs
subj:09003002.description: The reduction of a company's work force through dismissal because of changing economic factors

subj:09003003.name: child labor
subj:09003003.description: Employment of children, usually under the age of 18

subj:09003004.name: occupations
subj:09003004.description: Generally one's trade, profession or business although professions are usually such things as lawyers and doctors, and occupations are such as clerks or truckers

subj:09004000.name: labour dispute
subj:09004000.description: Differences of opinion about work conditions, pay, etc

subj:09007000.name: retraining
subj:09007000.description: Providing a worker training in new skills when his old skills are no longer applicable

subj:09008000.name: strike
subj:09008000.description: A job action involving cessation of work

subj:09010000.name: unions
subj:09010000.description: Groups established to represent bodies of workers

subj:09011000.name: wage and pension
subj:09011000.description: Parts of a salary divided for current income and future income

subj:09011001.name: employee benefits
subj:09011001.description: Either benefits provided to an employee by a company, such as pensions, health insurance; or monetary compensation paid by a government to the jobless usually called unemployment benefits

subj:09011002.name: social security
subj:09011002.description: FICA. Money paid by individual and companies into a government account to be paid out when that individual reaches a certain age

subj:09012000.name: work relations
subj:09012000.description: The give and take between management and labour

subj:09013000.name: health and safety at work
subj:09013000.description: Rules and procedures for guaranteeing the health of workers

subj:09014000.name: advanced training
subj:09014000.description: Additional training to enhance current skills

subj:09015000.name: employer
subj:09015000.description: The person who employs workers and pays the salaries and other benefits to workers

subj:09016000.name: employee
subj:09016000.description: A person who trades his time and talent for money and other benefits

subj:10000000.name: lifestyle and leisure
subj:10000000.description: Activities undertaken for pleasure, relaxation or recreation outside paid employment, including eating and travel.

subj:10001001.name: Go
subj:10001001.description: A strategic, deterministic Chinese board game played by alternately placing stones on a grid

subj:10001002.name: chess
subj:10001002.description: A game played on a chequered board with 16 pieces to each side with specific ranges of movement depending on their identity

subj:10001003.name: bridge
subj:10001003.description: A card game of four players who bet on the hands of each other, developed from Russian whist

subj:10001004.name: shogi
subj:10001004.description: A strategic board games which is native to Japan and is often called Japanese chess

subj:10002000.name: gaming and lottery
subj:10002000.description: Gambling, often involving selection of sets of numbers one expects to come up

subj:10003001.name: organic foods
subj:10003001.description: Food which is grown using no artificial fertilizers or chemical compounds

subj:10004000.name: hobby
subj:10004000.description: Various types of activities for amusement, such as collecting stamps, building models, quilting, crafts

subj:10004001.name: DIY
subj:10004001.description: DIY - do it yourself. Normally the construction, repair or maintenance of residential property by an amateur

subj:10004002.name: shopping
subj:10004002.description: Consumer purchasing and related trends, but not the business aspects of retailing

subj:10004003.name: gardening
subj:10004003.description: The non-commercial aspects of landscaping, growing plants, trees and other vegetation that gives pleasure to the gardener and others

subj:10005000.name: holiday or vacation
subj:10005000.description: Leisure travel to a single location and/or country over a short period of time

subj:10006000.name: tourism
subj:10006000.description: Leisure travel involving visits to a number of locations and/or countries over an extended period of time, often as part of an organized group

subj:10007000.name: travel and commuting
subj:10007000.description: Transport options, travel networks, commuting, car pooling and business travel

subj:10008000.name: club and association
subj:10008000.description: Organizations joined by individuals because of similar interests

subj:10009000.name: lifestyle (house and home)
subj:10009000.description: Unique culture of ones own home

subj:10010000.name: leisure (general)
subj:10010000.description: Activities carried out in ones' spare time

subj:10011000.name: public holiday
subj:10011000.description: A day or days set off for celebration

subj:10012000.name: hunting
subj:10012000.description: An activity involving the use of weapons or traps for the capturing of animals

subj:10013000.name: fishing
subj:10013000.description: An activity involving the use of baits, lures, weapons and traps for the capture of aquatic species

subj:10015000.name: adventure
subj:10015000.description: Expeditions, daring feats, exploration, record-breaking, risk-associated events

subj:10016000.name: beauty
subj:10016000.description: Issues relating to improving one's appearance and attractiveness, including reviews of beauty products

subj:10017000.name: consumer issue
subj:10017000.description: Shopping, products for the home, relevant surveys, product recalls

subj:10018000.name: wedding
subj:10018000.description: The marriage ceremony and the events that surround it - showers, rehearsal, parties, honeymoon, etc.

subj:11000000.name: politics
subj:11000000.description: Local, regional, national and international exercise of power, or struggle for power, and the relationships between governing bodies and states.

subj:11001000.name: defence
subj:11001000.description: Anything involving the defence of one's own country

subj:11001001.name: veterans affairs
subj:11001001.description: Care and provision for those who served in the military

subj:11001002.name: national security
subj:11001002.description: The philosophy of securing a nation and its borders, as well as the well being of its citizens

subj:11001003.name: security measures
subj:11001003.description: Means of making a nation, a state, a building or a person secure from harm and outside interference.

subj:11001004.name: armed Forces
subj:11001004.description: Those employed by a government to conduct war, or to enforce the security of a nation

subj:11001005.name: military equipment
subj:11001005.description: Equipment issued to members of the armed forces

subj:11001006.name: firearms
subj:11001006.description: Anything that uses an explosive in a directed manner to propel an object that can maim or kill

subj:11001007.name: biological and chemical weapons
subj:11001007.description: Devices using biological agents, or chemical mixtures to disable, maim or kill an opponent

subj:11001008.name: missile systems
subj:11001008.description: Anything that propels an inert, explosive, biological or chemical object through the air with the aim of disabling, maiming or killing an opponent.

subj:11001009.name: nuclear weapons
subj:11001009.description: Weapons that use controlled radioactivity from the decay of certain elements to disable, maim or kill an opponent

subj:11002000.name: diplomacy
subj:11002000.description: The use of verbal and written skills for persuading others to your point of view

subj:11002001.name: summit
subj:11002001.description: Includes meetings of leaders, foreign and finance ministers from the Group of Eight major nations and Group of Seven industrialized nations.

subj:11002002.name: international relations
subj:11002002.description: Non-violent relations between nations through negotiation, treaty, or personal meetings

subj:11002003.name: peace negotiations
subj:11002003.description: Negotiations intended to bring an end to a conflict

subj:11002004.name: alliances
subj:11002004.description: Coalitions of like-minded groups formed to present a stronger force against any challenges

subj:11003000.name: election
subj:11003000.description: The selection of representatives by the casting of votes

subj:11003001.name: political candidates
subj:11003001.description: Individuals who are chosen to stand for office

subj:11003003.name: campaign finance
subj:11003003.description: The money that makes campaigns for public office possible

subj:11003004.name: national elections
subj:11003004.description: Choosing individuals for government at a national level

subj:11003005.name: regional elections
subj:11003005.description: Choosing individuals for government at a regional level

subj:11003006.name: local elections
subj:11003006.description: Choosing individuals for government at the basic level, whether city, village or county

subj:11003007.name: voting
subj:11003007.description: The act of selecting an individual you would like to represent your interests in government

subj:11003008.name: poll
subj:11003008.description: Periodic measurement of a political candidate's standing with the public

subj:11003009.name: european elections
subj:11003009.description: Choosing individuals for a body which is at a higher level than national government, e.g. European parliament

subj:11003010.name: primary
subj:11003010.description: Preliminary elections on a local or regional basis leading up to a regional or national election

subj:11005000.name: foreign aid
subj:11005000.description: Help provided by one nation to another

subj:11005001.name: economic sanction
subj:11005001.description: Punitive actions taken by one country against another including trade restrictions, embargoes etc.

subj:11006000.name: government
subj:11006000.description: The system for ruling a country

subj:11006001.name: civil and public service
subj:11006001.description: The paid service by civilians for the government, and the often non-paid service of individuals for the benefit of others (public service)

subj:11006002.name: safety of citizens
subj:11006002.description: Government policies to protect the well being of its citizens

subj:11006003.name: think tank
subj:11006003.description: Group that undertakes political research and issue position papers, recommendations etc

subj:11006004.name: national government
subj:11006004.description: The ruling body of a nation

subj:11006005.name: executive (government)
subj:11006005.description: That portion of a ruling body involving the overall operation of government

subj:11006006.name: heads of state
subj:11006006.description: Symbolic or actual chief representative of a nation, such as royalty, or president or emir, for example

subj:11006007.name: government departments
subj:11006007.description: Divisions of a government that concentrate on specific areas such as health, welfare, economy or war

subj:11006008.name: public officials
subj:11006008.description: Individuals, usually elected, who are in public service or commonly in the public eye.

subj:11006009.name: ministers (government)
subj:11006009.description: Heads of various government departments at one level, also known as secretaries. At another level they form a legislative body. The chief minister is either prime minister or premier.

subj:11006010.name: public employees
subj:11006010.description: People employed by a government at all levels

subj:11006011.name: privatisation
subj:11006011.description: The privatisation of state-owned companies or property

subj:11006012.name: nationalisation
subj:11006012.description: State takeover of private companies or property

subj:11006013.name: impeachment
subj:11006013.description: The process of bringing a public official before a tribunal to answer charges of wrongdoing

subj:11007000.name: human rights
subj:11007000.description: Rights entitled to be enjoyed by all citizens universally

subj:11008000.name: local authority
subj:11008000.description: Authorities at city, county state or borough level

subj:11009000.name: parliament
subj:11009000.description: The collective body of elected officials representing the people

subj:11009001.name: upper house
subj:11009001.description: Senior chamber of a legislative body

subj:11009002.name: lower house
subj:11009002.description: The lower chamber of a legislative body

subj:11010000.name: parties and movements
subj:11010000.description: Covers both formally recognized and informal political associations

subj:11010001.name: non government organizations (NGO)
subj:11010001.description: Groups officially outside of government that lobby, demonstrate or campaign on a wide range of issues such as economics, environment healthcare etc.

subj:11011000.name: refugee
subj:11011000.description: A person seeking shelter in another country because of some fear of persecution in his own country

subj:11012000.name: regional authority
subj:11012000.description: Government bodies at levels encompassing more than one jurisdiction, e.g. the Delaware River Basin Commission

subj:11013000.name: state budget and tax
subj:11013000.description: The national budget as promulgated by the government

subj:11013001.name: public finance
subj:11013001.description: The money of government used for paying for public programs and services and public debt

subj:11015000.name: constitution
subj:11015000.description: Usually a written document setting forth the operations of a government and the rights of the citizens therein

subj:11016000.name: interior policy
subj:11016000.description: Government policies affecting internal affairs of a country

subj:11016001.name: data protection
subj:11016001.description: Efforts to protect personal information in either written, oral or electronic form

subj:11016002.name: housing and urban planning
subj:11016002.description: Systematic planning of urban and suburban areas and the housing within those areas

subj:11016003.name: pension and welfare
subj:11016003.description: Government policies affecting the well being of its citizens through unemployment benefits, state pensions and other similar payments

subj:11016004.name: personal weapon control
subj:11016004.description: Government control of personal ownership of firearms and other offensive weapons, including control of weapons used for sports through licenses and other means

subj:11016006.name: personal data collection
subj:11016006.description: The collection, by government or other entities of information on individuals

subj:11016007.name: planning inquiries
subj:11016007.description: Public hearings or planning inquiries on proposed constructions, e.g. Construction of water driven power station in a National Park.

subj:11017000.name: migration
subj:11017000.description: Movement of one body of persons from one place to another

subj:11018000.name: citizens initiative and recall
subj:11018000.description: Political suggestions by non-government officials for corrective action, or for changes in existing rules and regulations

subj:11019000.name: referenda
subj:11019000.description: Political proposals, laws and actions suggested by non-government officials to be voted on by the entire voting body

subj:11020000.name: nuclear policy
subj:11020000.description: Government policies as regards to use of nuclear fuels for power production or weapons

subj:11021000.name: lobbying
subj:11021000.description: The attempt by non-government bodies and individual to affect the outcome of legislation through verbal, or other, persuasion

subj:11022000.name: regulatory policy and organisation
subj:11022000.description: The rules and bodies, both national and international, that govern conflict of interest and good practice regulations.

subj:11023000.name: censorship
