subj:11023000.description: Attempts by any group to control freedoms of speech, religion, and ideas distributed in print, graphics, cyberspace and other ways. Does not include official standards such as cinema ratings, advertising and broadcast standards.

subj:11024000.name: politics (general)
subj:11024000.description: The art or science of participating in the affairs of government, a state of political party

subj:11024001.name: political systems
subj:11024001.description: Systems designed to provide order to government

subj:11024002.name: democracy
subj:11024002.description: Government in which the people hold the power either directly, or through elected officials.

subj:11024003.name: political development
subj:11024003.description: The creation and rise of political systems and the history of the people and nations that are associated with those systems.

subj:11025000.name: freedom of the press
subj:11025000.description: Mass media rights and freedoms, pressure and intimidation of the journalists, censorship in mass media, activities of government bodies, journalistic associations and/or organizations and other NGOs in regards to press freedom

subj:11026000.name: freedom of religion
subj:11026000.description: Religious rights and freedoms, pressure and intimidation of the believers, censorship in mass media, activities of government bodies, journalistic associations and/or organizations and other NGOs in regards to freedom of belief and practice

subj:11027000.name: treaty
subj:11027000.description: A treaty (as defined by the Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties) is a written agreement between international entities that is binding under international law.

subj:11028000.name: international organisation
subj:11028000.description: Includes organisations with members and functions that cross international borders, and may include intergovernmental organisations of sovereign nations.

subj:12000000.name: religion and belief
subj:12000000.description: All aspects of human existence involving theology, philosophy, ethics and spirituality.

subj:12001000.name: cult and sect
subj:12001000.description: Offshoots of established religious bodies, or small narrow-focused group promulgated by one or two individuals

subj:12002000.name: belief (faith)
subj:12002000.description: The established beliefs of an individuals religion

subj:12002001.name: unificationism
subj:12002001.description: The belief system of members of the Unification Church established by the Rev. Sun Myung Moon.

subj:12002002.name: scientology
subj:12002002.description: Believe that man is a spiritual being endowed with abilities well beyond those which he normally envisages; he's able to solve his own problems, accomplish his goals and gain lasting happiness.

subj:12003000.name: freemasonry
subj:12003000.description: A secret international society based on the principles of brotherhood, charity and mutual aid

subj:12006001.name: ethics
subj:12006001.description: A system of beliefs about acceptable behaviour

subj:12006002.name: corrupt practices
subj:12006002.description: Any action which is harmful to others

subj:12007000.name: church and state relations
subj:12007000.description: The legal and social division between religious institutions and the affairs of state

subj:12008000.name: philosophy
subj:12008000.description: Different thoughts about the way the world works

subj:12009000.name: christianity
subj:12009000.description: Those that use Jesus Christ and his teachings as their centre of belief

subj:12009001.name: protestant
subj:12009001.description: General term for christian churches and religious communities which developed through the reformation in the 16th century

subj:12009002.name: lutheran
subj:12009002.description: Christians who follow the teaching of reformer Martin Luther

subj:12009003.name: reformed
subj:12009003.description: Christians who follow the teaching of reformers Johannes Calvin and Ulrich Zwingli

subj:12009004.name: anglican
subj:12009004.description: Members of the worldwide anglican communion which started in the 16th century in England as a breakaway church from the roman catholic church

subj:12009005.name: methodist
subj:12009005.description: Followers of John and Charles Wesley who tried to reform the Church of England in the 18th century and turned into a separate church

subj:12009006.name: baptist
subj:12009006.description: Members of a christian church which only baptises adults who truly believe in Christ

subj:12009007.name: mennonite
subj:12009007.description: Members of a 16th century christian church which is against military service and baptising infants

subj:12009009.name: mormon
subj:12009009.description: Members of a religious community which believes in the Book of Mormon" and the revelations of founder M.J. Smith "

subj:12009010.name: roman catholic
subj:12009010.description: Biggest christian church worldwide tracing its origins back to Jesus Christ

subj:12009011.name: old catholic
subj:12009011.description: Members of a catholic church which started in 1870 and denies the dogma of the infallibility of the pope

subj:12009012.name: orthodoxy
subj:12009012.description: Eastern rite churches which are characterised by their continuity with the apostolic church, their liturgy and their territorial churches, mainly in eastern and south-eastern Europe and the Middle East

subj:12009013.name: salvation army
subj:12009013.description: Christian community organised in a military fashion which does missionary and social work

subj:12010000.name: islam
subj:12010000.description: Those who use Allah and his teachings as their centre of belief

subj:12011000.name: judaism
subj:12011000.description: A group believing in one god, basing their beliefs on written scriptures and the Talmud, including the first coming of the Messiah

subj:12012000.name: buddhism
subj:12012000.description: A major Asian religion founded by Buddha in the 6th century BC in India and preaching that right thinking and self denial will lead to a divine state without desire

subj:12013000.name: hinduism
subj:12013000.description: A religious and social system, believing in a caste system with the Brahmans the highest and untouchables the lowest.

subj:12014000.name: religious festival or holiday
subj:12014000.description: Holy day or day of observance in a religion which sometimes is a public holiday as well

subj:12014001.name: christmas
subj:12014001.description: Christian festival in commemorating the birth of Jesus Christ

subj:12014002.name: easter
subj:12014002.description: Christian festival in commemorating the resurrection of Jesus Christ

subj:12014003.name: pentecost
subj:12014003.description: Christian festival, celebrated on the 50th day after Easter commemorating the descent of the Holy Spirit

subj:12014004.name: ramadan
subj:12014004.description: Holy month of fasting in Islam

subj:12014005.name: yom kippur
subj:12014005.description: Most solemn of Jewish religious holidays, observed on the 10th day of the lunar month of tishri (in the course of September and October, when Jews seek reconciliation with god

subj:12015000.name: religious leader
subj:12015000.description: Person or persons who have a ritual, juridical or otherwise leading role in their respective church or religion

subj:12015001.name: pope
subj:12015001.description: Head of the roman catholic church worldwide

subj:12016000.name: nature religion
subj:12016000.description: Worship of natural elements like fire, water, trees, mountains

subj:12017000.name: taoism
subj:12017000.description: Indigenous religio-philosophical tradition that has shaped Chinese life for more than 2000 years

subj:12018000.name: shintoism
subj:12018000.description: Indigenous religious beliefs and practices of Japan. The word Shinto came into use in order to distinguish indigenous Japanese beliefs from Buddhism.

subj:12019000.name: sikhism
subj:12019000.description: The religion of an Indian group, combining Hindu and Islamic elements, founded in the Punjab (or Panjab) in the late 15th century AD by Guru Nanak.

subj:12020000.name: jainism
subj:12020000.description: A religion of India that teaches a path to spiritual purity and enlightenment through a disciplined mode of life founded upon the tradition of ahimsa, non-violence to all living creatures. It began in the 7th-5th century BC.

subj:12021000.name: parsasm
subj:12021000.description: A religion in India following the Iranian prophet Zoroaster, mainly in Bombay, but also in Karachi (Pakistan).

subj:12022000.name: confucianism
subj:12022000.description: The way of life propagated by Confucius in the 6th-5th century BC and followed by the Chinese people for more than 2000 years. Its influence has extended to Korea, Japan, and Vietnam.

subj:12023000.name: religious text
subj:12023000.description: Scriptures holy or important for a church or religion

subj:12023001.name: bible
subj:12023001.description: Sacred scriptures of Christianity consisting of the old and new testament

subj:12024000.name: interreligious dialogue
subj:12024000.description: Any form of communication between religions

subj:12025000.name: religious event
subj:12025000.description: News regarding a religious event but not a festival or holiday

subj:12025004.name: ritual
subj:12025004.description: Established religious rituals such as mass, baptism, prayer meetings

subj:12026000.name: concordat
subj:12026000.description: Treaty between the Holy See and another country for the regulation of ecclesiastical affairs in the territory of the latter

subj:13000000.name: science and technology
subj:13000000.description: All aspects pertaining to human understanding of nature and the physical world and the development and application of this knowledge

subj:13001000.name: applied science
subj:13001000.description: Stories about putting scientific knowledge to practical uses in the fields of the medical sciences, agriculture, domestic sciences as well as trades and crafts

subj:13001001.name: physics
subj:13001001.description: The study of the properties and changes of matter

subj:13001002.name: chemistry
subj:13001002.description: The study of the composition and reaction of substances

subj:13001003.name: cosmology
subj:13001003.description: Study of the organization and structure of the universe

subj:13001004.name: particle physics
subj:13001004.description: The study of elementary particles and atomic nuclei through the use of high-energy particles

subj:13002000.name: engineering
subj:13002000.description: Stories about putting scientific knowledge to practical uses in the fields of civil, electrical, mechanical and chemical engineering

subj:13002001.name: material science
subj:13002001.description: The study of materials used in manufacturing

subj:13003000.name: human science
subj:13003000.description: Sociology, psychology, anthropology and political science

subj:13003001.name: social sciences
subj:13003001.description: The study of people living in groups, as families, tribes and communities

subj:13003002.name: history
subj:13003002.description: The study of human events of the past

subj:13003003.name: psychology
subj:13003003.description: The study of the human mind and mental and emotional processes

subj:13003004.name: sociology
subj:13003004.description: The study of human social relations, organization and change

subj:13003005.name: anthropology
subj:13003005.description: The study of human beings in groups or societies

subj:13004000.name: natural science
subj:13004000.description: Astronomy, astrophysics, physics, chemistry, earth sciences, palaeontology, biological sciences, botany and zoology, as well as mathematics

subj:13004001.name: geology
subj:13004001.description: The study of Earth's physical processes

subj:13004003.name: geography
subj:13004003.description: The study of the surface of Earth and its political divisions

subj:13004006.name: physiology
subj:13004006.description: The study of vital processes of living organisms

subj:13004007.name: astronomy
subj:13004007.description: The study of the stars and planets

subj:13005000.name: philosophical science
subj:13005000.description: Philosophy, logic and ethics, among others

subj:13006000.name: research
subj:13006000.description: Methodical investigation of events, procedures etc to explain why they occur, or to find solutions for problems

subj:13006001.name: survey
subj:13006001.description: Examination of public attitudes on various subjects or issues, such as the quality of goods, the value of services etc.

subj:13007000.name: scientific exploration
subj:13007000.description: Methodical land, sea and space journeys to discover new information about them

subj:13008000.name: space programme
subj:13008000.description: The government's organized effort for the exploration of outer space and the bodies therein

subj:13009000.name: science (general)
subj:13009000.description: Establishing and systematizing information about nature and the physical world through observation, experimentation and hypothesis

subj:13010000.name: technology (general)
subj:13010000.description: The study of the practical or industrial arts, and applied sciences such as physics, hydrodynamics and thermodynamics

subj:13010002.name: laser
subj:13010002.description: The development and use of light amplification by stimulated emission of radiation

subj:13011000.name: standards
subj:13011000.description: The rules, national and international, that govern science and technology. These might include international standards setting for equipment and interference standards.

subj:13013000.name: micro science
subj:13013000.description: The multi-disciplinary areas of nanotechnology and Micro-Electrical Mechanical Systems.

subj:13014000.name: marine science
subj:13014000.description: The multi-disciplinary research areas involving the worlds' waterways and oceans. This could include hyper-spectral sensing of ice flows, fisheries studies and underwater research.

subj:13015000.name: weather science
subj:13015000.description: All scientific aspects of the weather and climate.

subj:13016000.name: electronics
subj:13016000.description: The branch of engineering or physics concerned with the controlled flow of electrons or other carriers of electric charges, especially in semiconductor devices, including the design, manufacture, and maintenance of electronic devices

subj:13017000.name: identification technology
subj:13017000.description: Includes biometrics, new computer-based identification cards, retinal scans, face scanning and mobile augmented reality systems (MARS) and other ways technology can identify individuals. Also technology vs. the privacy of personal information.

subj:13018000.name: mathematics
subj:13018000.description: The study of quantities and shapes and their symbolic relationships.

subj:13019000.name: biotechnology
subj:13019000.description: Manipulating natural organisms for scientific, medical or agricultural purposes

subj:13020000.name: agricultural research and technology
subj:13020000.description: Pertaining to the growing of crops and management of farm animals

subj:13021000.name: nanotechnology
subj:13021000.description: Manipulating objects at the molecular scale

subj:13022000.name: IT/computer sciences
subj:13022000.description: The study and design of computer systems and networks.

subj:13023000.name: scientific institutions
subj:13023000.description: Institutions that carry out or govern scientific work (e.g. National Academy of Arts and Sciences )

subj:14000000.name: social issue
subj:14000000.description: Aspects of the behaviour of humans affecting the quality of life.

subj:14001000.name: addiction
subj:14001000.description: The habitual and often uncontrollable use of harmful substances such as alcohol, tobacco and pharmaceuticals or drugs

subj:14003000.name: demographics
subj:14003000.description: The study of people and here they live and how they interact

subj:14003001.name: population and census
subj:14003001.description: Population is the number of people in a geographical region and census is the process of counting them

subj:14003002.name: immigration
subj:14003002.description: Movement of individuals from one country to the other

subj:14003003.name: illegal immigrants
subj:14003003.description: Movement of individuals from one country to the other by illicit means

subj:14003004.name: emigrants
subj:14003004.description: People who leave their country of origin, their relationship with their country of origin and their association with fellow emigrants

subj:14004000.name: disabled
subj:14004000.description: Being incapacitated either physically, emotionally or mentally

subj:14005000.name: euthanasia (also includes assisted suicide)
subj:14005000.description: Voluntary death with the aid of another

subj:14006000.name: family
subj:14006000.description: A group of individuals related by blood or marriage

subj:14006001.name: parent and child
subj:14006001.description: Two or more individuals with a hierarchical familial relationship

subj:14006002.name: adoption
subj:14006002.description: A legal process of bringing a child with no supporting parents into a supportive union

subj:14006003.name: marriage
subj:14006003.description: The union of two individuals who pledge fidelity, respect and support for each other

subj:14006004.name: divorce
subj:14006004.description: The process by which a marriage is dissolved

subj:14006005.name: sex
subj:14006005.description: The classification of individuals as either male or female. Or conjugal relationship between two individuals.

subj:14006006.name: courtship
subj:14006006.description: Preliminaries of wooing and winning a partner

subj:14007000.name: family planning
subj:14007000.description: Conscious decisions and efforts involving reproduction

subj:14009000.name: homelessness
subj:14009000.description: Lacking a fixed place of residence

subj:14010000.name: minority group
subj:14010000.description: A group of people classified by race, language, religion or other characteristic numerically smaller than others of the same classification

subj:14010001.name: gays and lesbians
subj:14010001.description: Those that consider themselves attracted to their same gender in an erotic or sensual or similar way.

subj:14010002.name: national or ethnic minority
subj:14010002.description: Groups of people that form a minority on ethnic or national basis, their status, problems and relations to the majority

subj:14011000.name: pornography
subj:14011000.description: Audio or visual depictions of various sex related acts considered outside accepted community standards

subj:14012000.name: poverty
subj:14012000.description: Having insufficient resources to provide for basic services to oneself or family

subj:14013000.name: prostitution
subj:14013000.description: Sex for sale, either male or female, and those who profit from it

subj:14014000.name: racism
subj:14014000.description: Harmful attitudes toward another group based on racial differences

subj:14015000.name: welfare
subj:14015000.description: Generally government help for those in need of food, housing health and other services

subj:14016000.name: abortion
subj:14016000.description: Usually the planned disruption of the process of reproduction of human life

subj:14017000.name: missing person
subj:14017000.description: A person who is not where they are expected to be for a period of time

subj:14017001.name: missing due to hostilities
subj:14017001.description: People, both civilian and military, missing during or after hostilities

subj:14018000.name: long term care
subj:14018000.description: Extensive health care because of serious illness or disability

subj:14019000.name: juvenile delinquency
subj:14019000.description: Incidents involving perpetrators who are minors.

subj:14020000.name: nuclear radiation victims
subj:14020000.description: Includes antinuclear movements and compensation for atomic blast victims.

subj:14021000.name: slavery
subj:14021000.description: The involuntary servitude, outside of legal incarceration for statuary criminal offences, of men, women and children, including involuntary unpaid labour, coerced actions, child labour

subj:14022000.name: abusive behaviour
subj:14022000.description: The maltreatment of one or more individuals by others through dehumanizing treatment including sexual or mental abuse, deprivation of sensory abilities, deprivation of physical needs, physical mistreatment including beatings, and other forms of torture

subj:14023000.name: death and dying
subj:14023000.description: Dying is the route to death. Death is the state you are in when there are no signs that you can function as a human being either physically or mentally

subj:14024000.name: people
subj:14024000.description: Individuals as a whole, sometimes broken down into various classes, such as indigenous people, people of class etc

subj:14024001.name: children
subj:14024001.description: Immature people, usually up to the age of puberty

subj:14024002.name: infants
subj:14024002.description: Those people from birth until ages of one or two, usually when they begin walking

subj:14024003.name: teen-agers
subj:14024003.description: People aged 13 to 19 years of age

subj:14025000.name: social issues (general)
subj:14025000.description: Issues affecting a number of individuals in their daily lives like housing, food, education, personal relationships

subj:14025001.name: social conditions
subj:14025001.description: Conditions under which people live in terms of housing, water supply, availability of education

subj:14025002.name: social problems
subj:14025002.description: Issues affecting the lives of individuals such as housing, education nutrition, communication etc

subj:14025003.name: discrimination
subj:14025003.description: Denial of services to one or more people because of race, colour, sexual identity, religion, political beliefs etc

subj:14025004.name: social services
subj:14025004.description: Government supported programs to improve the well-being of individuals or groups of individuals

subj:14025005.name: death penalty policies
subj:14025005.description: National or international polices regarding death sentences

subj:14026000.name: ordnance clearance
subj:14026000.description: The removal or neutralization of ordnance such as landmines or cluster bombs, remaining after a war or armed conflict

subj:14027000.name: reconstruction
subj:14027000.description: The reconstruction of economy, infrastructure and property, as well as life in general, after a war or natural disaster

subj:15000000.name: sport
subj:15000000.description: Competitive exercise involving physical effort. Organizations and bodies involved in these activities.

subj:15001000.name: aero and aviation sport
subj:15001000.description: Parachuting, freefall (parapente, delta-plane), gliding, aerostat, motorised flight (airplane, ultra light craft, helicopter)

subj:15001001.name: parachuting
subj:15001001.description: Parachuting competitions: precision landings, voltige, individual and team

subj:15002000.name: alpine skiing
subj:15002000.description: Skiing downhill on snow-covered slopes as fast as possible. The slopes contain intermediate gates which are spaced according to the discipline involved

subj:15002001.name: downhill
subj:15002001.description: Skiing at top speed down a steep slope with interspersed turns but no gates. The fastest wins.

subj:15002002.name: giant slalom
subj:15002002.description: Skiing down a slope, but with more turns and bends than in super-G skiing. The fastest wins.

subj:15002003.name: super G
subj:15002003.description: Skiing down a steep slope, but with more turns and bends than in the downhill. The fastest wins.

subj:15002004.name: slalom
subj:15002004.description: Skiers must zig-zag their way down a slope with closely positioned gates which they must negotiate. It is run over two legs with the combined fastest winning.

subj:15002005.name: combined
subj:15002005.description: Race, usually competed over two days that combines a downhill leg and a slalom leg rewarding the most complete skiers. Combined fastest time wins.

subj:15003000.name: American football
subj:15003000.description: Team ball game that opposes two teams that have attack sections and defence sections. Each attack goes up against the other defence and attempts to move an oval-shaped ball down the field and into the end-zone to mark a touchdown and earn points.

subj:15003001.name: (US) National Football League (NFL) (North American)
subj:15003001.description: The association of professional American football teams

subj:15003002.name: CFL
subj:15003002.description: The Canadian Football League (CFL), also known as Ligue Canadienne de Football (LCF), is a professional league located entirely in Canada that plays Canadian football.

subj:15003003.name: AFL-DEPRECATED
subj:15003003.description: The American Football League (AFL) was a professional league of American football that operated from 1960 to 1969. In 1970, the AFL merged with the National Football League.

subj:15004000.name: archery
subj:15004000.description: Archers use bows and arrows to aim at targets 1.22 metres in diameter which are on average 70 metres distant.

subj:15004001.name: FITA / Outdoor target archery
subj:15004001.description: The competition is held outdoors on an open (flat) field, at various fixed distances. The archery competition in the Olympic Games is a part of the FITA outdoor target archery program.

subj:15004002.name: crossbow shooting
subj:15004002.description: Shooting with crossbow on targets from different distances

subj:15005000.name: athletics, track and field
subj:15005000.description: Competitions involving foot races, jumping and throwing which can be on a track inside a stadium or on outside roads

subj:15005001.name: 100 m
subj:15005001.description: Running over a distance of 100 metres with the fastest time winning

subj:15005002.name: 200 m
subj:15005002.description: Running over a distance of 200 metres with the fastest time winning

subj:15005003.name: 400 m
subj:15005003.description: Running over a distance of 400 metres with the fastest time winning

subj:15005004.name: 800 m
subj:15005004.description: Running over a distance of 800 metres with the fastest time winning

subj:15005005.name: 1000 m
subj:15005005.description: Running over a distance of 1000 metres with the fastest time winning

subj:15005006.name: 1500 m
subj:15005006.description: Running over a distance of 1000 metres with the fastest time winning

subj:15005007.name: mile
subj:15005007.description: Running over a distance of one mile with the fastest time winning

subj:15005008.name: 2000 m
subj:15005008.description: Running over a distance of 2000 metres with the fastest time winning

subj:15005009.name: 3000 m
subj:15005009.description: Running over a distance of 3000 metres with the fastest time winning

subj:15005010.name: 5000 m
subj:15005010.description: Running over a distance of 5000 metres with the fastest time winning

subj:15005011.name: 10,000 m
subj:15005011.description: Running over a distance of 10,000 metres with the fastest time winning

subj:15005012.name: 20 km
subj:15005012.description: Walking over a distance of 20 km on public roads with the fastest time winning

subj:15005013.name: one hour
subj:15005013.description: Walking as far as possible in the time of one hour

subj:15005014.description: Walking over a distance of 25km with the fastest time winning

subj:15005015.description: Walking over a distance of 30kms with the fastest time winning

subj:15005016.name: 110 m hurdles
subj:15005016.description: Race consisting of covering 110 metres as fast as possible while jumping over 10 hurdles placed on the track

subj:15005017.name: 400 m hurdles
subj:15005017.description: Race consisting of covering 400 metres as fast as possible while jumping over 10 hurdles placed on the track

subj:15005018.name: 3000 m steeplechase
subj:15005018.description: Race consisting of covering 3000 metres as fast as possible while jumping over 28 hurdles which are 91/4 centimetres high and seven water obstacles

subj:15005019.name: high jump
subj:15005019.description: Competitors jump as high as possible over a bar which is raised each time they clear the height. The highest clearance wins.

subj:15005020.name: pole vault
subj:15005020.description: Competitors use a flexible pole to propel themselves feet-first into the air and clear a bar which is raised higher at each round of jumps.

subj:15005021.name: long jump
subj:15005021.description: Competitors build up speed over a short sprint and them attempt to jump as far forward as they can from a given point into sand trap. The longest jump wins.

subj:15005022.name: triple jump
subj:15005022.description: Competitors build up speed over a short sprint and then attempt to jump as far forward as they can using a hop, skip and a jump technique. The longest jump wins.

subj:15005023.name: shot put
subj:15005023.description: Competitors stand in a circle with a 2.13 metres diameter and attempt to throw a metal ball weighing 7.26 kg for men and 4kg for women as far as possible. The longest throw wins.

subj:15005024.name: discus throw
subj:15005024.description: Competitors stand in a netted circle with a 2.50 metres diameter and with a turning motion attempt to throw a discus weighing 2kg for men and 1kg for women as far as possible. The longest throw wins.

subj:15005025.name: hammer throw
subj:15005025.description: Competitors throw a hammer consisting of a metal ball, chain and handle as far as they can from a netted circle which is 2.13 metres in diameter. The hammer weighs 7.26 kg for men and 4 kg for women.

subj:15005026.name: javelin throw
subj:15005026.description: Competitors in a specially-designated throwing area attempt to fling a spear-like javelin as far as possible. The javelin weighs 800 grammes for men and 600 grammes for women.

subj:15005027.name: decathlon
subj:15005027.description: Individual men's competition which involves accumulating points in 10 different disciplines over two days: 1st day - 100m, long-jump, shot-putt, high-jump, 400m. 2nd day - 110m hurdles, discus, pole-vault, javelin and 1,500 metres.

subj:15005028.name: 4x100 m
subj:15005028.description: Team race involving four runners each covering 100 metres.

subj:15005029.name: 4x200 m
subj:15005029.description: Team race involving four runners each covering 200 metres.

subj:15005030.name: 4x400 m
subj:15005030.description: Team race involving four runners each covering 400 metres.

subj:15005031.name: 4x800 m
subj:15005031.description: Team race involving four runners each covering 800 metres.

subj:15005032.name: 4x1500 m
subj:15005032.description: Team race involving four runners each covering 1500 metres.

subj:15005033.name: walk 1 h
subj:15005033.description: One-hour long race where competitors must maintain at least one foot in contact with the ground and are not allowed to run.

subj:15005034.name: walk 2 h
subj:15005034.description: Two-hour long walking race where competitors must maintain at least one foot in contact with the ground and are not allowed to run.

subj:15005035.name: 10 km walk
subj:15005035.description: Walking race over 10 kilometres where competitors must maintain at least one foot in contact with the ground and are not allowed to run.

subj:15005036.name: 15 km walk
subj:15005036.description: Walking race over 15 kilometres where competitors must maintain at least one foot in contact with the ground and are not allowed to run.

subj:15005037.name: 20 km walk
subj:15005037.description: Walking race over 20 kilometres where competitors must maintain at least one foot in contact with the ground and are not allowed to run.

subj:15005038.name: 30 km walk
subj:15005038.description: Walking race over 30 kilometres where competitors must maintain at least one foot in contact with the ground and are not allowed to run.

subj:15005039.name: 50 km walk
subj:15005039.description: Walking race over 50 kilometres where competitors must maintain at least one foot in contact with the ground and are not allowed to run.

subj:15005040.name: 100 m hurdles
subj:15005040.description: Sprint over a distance of 110 metres with competitors having to clear 10 hurdles placed in their way.

subj:15005041.name: 5 km walk
subj:15005041.description: Walking race over 5 kilometres where competitors must maintain at least one foot in contact with the ground and are not allowed to run.

subj:15005042.name: heptathlon
subj:15005042.description: Individual women's competition involving seven separate disciplines over two days. 1st day - 100m hurdles, high-jump, shot-putt, 200 metres. 2nd day - long-jump, javelin, 800 metres.

subj:15005043.name: 1500 m walk
subj:15005043.description: Walking race over 1500 metres where competitors must maintain at least one foot in contact with the ground and are not allowed to run.

subj:15005044.name: 2000 m walk
subj:15005044.description: Walking race over 2000 metres where competitors must maintain at least one foot in contact with the ground and are not allowed to run.

subj:15005045.name: 3000 m walk
subj:15005045.description: Walking race over 3000 metres where competitors must maintain at least one foot in contact with the ground and are not allowed to run.

subj:15005046.name: 50 m
subj:15005046.description: Short sprint race over 50 metres with the fastest time winning.

subj:15005047.name: 50 m hurdles
subj:15005047.description: Short sprint race over 50 metres interspersed with hurdles.

subj:15005048.name: 50 yards
subj:15005048.description: Short sprint race over 50 yards with the fastest time winning.

subj:15005049.name: 50 yard hurdles
subj:15005049.description: Short sprint race over 50 yards interspersed with hurdles.

subj:15005050.name: 60 m
subj:15005050.description: Short sprint race over 60 metres with the fastest time winning.

subj:15005051.name: 60 m hurdles
subj:15005051.description: Short sprint race over 60 metres interspersed with hurdles.

subj:15005052.name: 60 yards
subj:15005052.description: Short sprint race over 60 yards with the fastest time winning.

subj:15005053.name: 60 yard hurdles
subj:15005053.description: Short sprint race over 60 yards interspersed with hurdles.

subj:15005054.name: 100 yards
subj:15005054.description: Sprint race over 100 yards with the fastest time winning.

subj:15005055.name: 100 yard hurdles
subj:15005055.description: Sprint race over 100 yards interspersed with hurdles.

subj:15005056.name: 300 m
subj:15005056.description: Race over 300 metres with the fastest time winning.

subj:15005057.name: 300 yards
subj:15005057.description: Race over 300 yards with the fastest time winning.

subj:15005058.name: 440 yards
subj:15005058.description: Race over 440 yards with the fastest time winning.

subj:15005059.name: 500 m
subj:15005059.description: Race over 500 metres with the fastest time winning.

subj:15005060.name: 500 yards
subj:15005060.description: Race over 500 yards with the fastest time winning.

subj:15005061.name: 600 m
subj:15005061.description: Race over 600 metres with the fastest time winning.

subj:15005062.name: 600 yards
subj:15005062.description: Race over 600 yards with the fastest time winning.

subj:15005063.name: 880 yards
subj:15005063.description: Race over 880 yards with the fastest time winning.

subj:15005064.name: 1000 yards
subj:15005064.description: Race over 1000 yards with the fastest time winning.

subj:15005065.name: 2 miles
subj:15005065.description: Race over two miles with the fastest time winning.

subj:15005066.name: 3 miles
subj:15005066.description: Race over three miles with the fastest time winning.

subj:15005067.name: 6 miles
subj:15005067.description: Race over six miles with the fastest time winning.

subj:15005068.name: 4x1 mile
subj:15005068.description: Team Relay race with four runners on each team running for one mile.

subj:15005069.name: pentathlon
subj:15005069.description: Only indoor, 60m hurdles, high jump, shot put, long jump, 800 m

subj:15006000.name: badminton
subj:15006000.description: Two players or two teams of two compete by hitting a shuttlecock weighing approximately five grams over a high net. The aim for each player/team is to prevent the shuttlecock landing on their side of the court.

subj:15007000.name: baseball
subj:15007000.description: A game between two teams of nine played on an enclosed ground. The team which scores the most points wins. A point is scored when a player runs around the ground marked out by four bases.

subj:15007001.name: Major League Baseball (North American Professional) - American League

subj:15007002.name: Major League Baseball (North American Professional) - National League

subj:15007003.name: Major League Baseball (North American Professional) - Special (e.g. All-Star, World Series)
subj:15007003.description: Baseball competition other than the World Series.

subj:15007004.name: rubberball baseball
subj:15007004.description: Sometimes called ''soft baseball,'' the game is played with a rubber baseball of varying degrees of hardness depending upon the age and level of the players.

subj:15007005.name: Major League Baseball Playoffs
subj:15007005.description: Consists of several rounds of play to determine representatives to the U.S.-based World Series

subj:15007006.name: World Series
subj:15007006.description: U.S.-based annual series of games between the top two teams of Major League Baseball to determine the overall champion

subj:15008000.name: basketball
subj:15008000.description: Game played between two teams of five - points are scored by placing the large inflated ball into a net fixed on a ring 3.05m above the ground.

subj:15008001.name: National Basketball Association (North American Professional)
subj:15008001.description: The NBA is the umbrella organisation running professional basketball in the United States. The NBA is made up of two conferences (east and west), four divisions (Atlantic and Central for the East, and Midwest and Pacific for the west).

subj:15008003.name: Swiss netball
subj:15008003.description: Similar to Basketball. Basket without a board. Mainly executed by women

subj:15008004.name: German netball
subj:15008004.description: Same as Swiss Netball, but with specific German rules

subj:15008005.name: Dutch netball
subj:15008005.description: Same as Swiss Netball, but with specific Dutch rule

subj:15009000.name: biathlon
subj:15009000.description: A combination of cross country skiing and target shooting in a pursuit format.

subj:15009001.name: 7.5 km
subj:15009001.description: Timed cross country skiing race. Competitors set off at 30sec intervals for three circuits totalling 7.5km.

subj:15009002.name: 10 km
subj:15009002.description: Sprint races for men, pursuit for women.

subj:15009003.name: 15 km
subj:15009003.description: Individual women's race in sprint format staged over three laps with competitors setting off at intervals of a minute.

subj:15009004.name: 20 km
subj:15009004.description: Individual men's race in sprint format staged over five laps with competitors setting off at intervals of a minute.

subj:15009005.name: 4x7.5 km relay
subj:15009005.description: Teams consisting of four biathletes with each team covering a distance of 7.5km with two rounds of target shooting.

subj:15009006.name: 12.5 km pursuit
subj:15009006.description: The start is determined by the results from the sprint. A race held over five laps with target shooting (standing or prone)

subj:15010000.name: billiards, snooker and pool
subj:15010000.description: A game played on a flat table covered with a cloth (baize) where players hit balls according to specific rules using a wooden cue.

subj:15010001.name: 8 ball
subj:15010001.description: A game using 15 balls and a white. The first player aims to pot the balls numbered 1-7 (solids) with the second player potting balls 9-15 (stripes). After that the first player to pot the black wins.

subj:15010002.name: 9 ball
subj:15010002.description: A game played with nine balls numbered 1-9, and a white. On each turn the player must hit the lowest numbered ball.

subj:15010003.name: 14-Jan
subj:15010003.description: A player nominates the ball he is attempting to pot and into which pocket. He collects points for each successful hit. He continues until he makes a mistake. Before hitting the 15th ball, the 14 reds are set up again in the triangle.

subj:15010006.name: snooker
subj:15010006.description: Two players using a cue and a white ball to sink" other coloured balls in a correct order on a baize table and to cause an opponent to miss-hit by positioning the white ball in an inappropriate place - snookering. "

subj:15011000.name: bobsleigh
subj:15011000.description: In bobsleigh two or four persons race down a course sitting in a sled that consists of a main hull, a frame, two axles and sets of runners. The total time of all heats in a competition is added together to determine the winner.

subj:15011001.name: two-man sled
subj:15011001.description: race consisting of a team of two competitors

subj:15011002.name: four-man sled
subj:15011002.description: race consisting of a team of four competitors

subj:15012000.name: bowling
subj:15012000.description: A game in which a player scores points by trying to knock down ten 'pins' using a ball - if unsuccessful the player has a second attempt. A game consists of ten frames.

subj:15013000.name: bowls and petanque
subj:15013000.description: A game in which players throw bowls at a target, the winner being the player who lands closest.

subj:15014000.name: boxing
subj:15014000.description: Combat sport in which two men/women fight using only their fists covered by padded gloves in a square ring measuring 6m a side. The fight is usually split into 12 rounds of three minutes each.

subj:15014001.name: super-heavyweight
subj:15014001.description: Weight category in boxing which varies according to the federation

subj:15014002.name: heavyweight
subj:15014002.description: Weight category in boxing which varies according to the federation

subj:15014003.name: cruiserweight
subj:15014003.description: Weight category in boxing which varies according to the federation

subj:15014004.name: light-heavyweight
subj:15014004.description: Weight category in boxing which varies according to the federation

subj:15014005.name: super-middleweight
subj:15014005.description: Weight category in boxing which varies according to the federation

subj:15014006.name: middleweight
subj:15014006.description: Weight category in boxing which varies according to the federation

subj:15014007.name: light-middleweight
subj:15014007.description: Weight category in boxing which varies according to the federation

subj:15014008.name: welterweight
subj:15014008.description: Weight category in boxing which varies according to the federation

subj:15014009.name: light-welterweight
subj:15014009.description: Weight category in boxing which varies according to the federation

subj:15014010.name: lightweight
subj:15014010.description: Weight category in boxing which varies according to the federation

subj:15014011.name: super-featherweight
subj:15014011.description: Weight category in boxing which varies according to the federation

subj:15014012.name: featherweight
subj:15014012.description: Weight category in boxing which varies according to the federation

subj:15014013.name: super-bantamweight
subj:15014013.description: Weight category in boxing which varies according to the federation

subj:15014014.name: bantamweight
subj:15014014.description: Weight category in boxing which varies according to the federation

subj:15014015.name: super-flyweight
subj:15014015.description: Weight category in boxing which varies according to the federation

subj:15014016.name: flyweight
subj:15014016.description: Weight category in boxing which varies according to the federation

subj:15014017.name: light flyweight
subj:15014017.description: Weight category in boxing which varies according to the federation

subj:15014018.name: straw
subj:15014018.description: Weight category in boxing which varies according to the federation

subj:15014023.name: French boxing
subj:15014023.description: Combat sport in which kicking with all parts of the feet are permitted and punching with the front of the fist is also allowed

subj:15014024.name: Thai boxing
subj:15014024.description: Form of boxing involving punches with fists, feet, knees, elbows and legs.

subj:15015001.name: Slalom
subj:15015001.description: White water course set out with gates consisting of two poles suspended vertically over the water. Competitors must negotiate the gates or face penalties

subj:15015005.name: K1
subj:15015005.description: an enclosed boat with the competitor sitting on a fixed seat for one person using a double bladed paddle

subj:15015006.name: K2
subj:15015006.description: an enclosed boat with the competitor sitting on a fixed seat for two people using double bladed paddles.

subj:15015007.name: K4
subj:15015007.description: an enclosed boat with the competitor sitting on a fixed seat for four people using double bladed paddles.

subj:15015008.name: C1
subj:15015008.description: One-seater canoe (open boat with competitor using a single bladed paddle.

subj:15015009.name: C2
subj:15015009.description: Two-seater canoe (open boat) - competitors use a single bladed paddle.

subj:15015010.name: C4
subj:15015010.description: Four-seater canoe (open boat) with each competitor using a single bladed paddle.

subj:15015011.name: canoe sailing
subj:15015011.description: A race involving a canoe equipped with a sail.

subj:15015012.name: pontoniering
subj:15015012.description: Team sport, military tradition, similar to canoe regatta, in boats

subj:15016002.name: sport climbing
subj:15016002.description: Sport climbing as a special category: individual competition, on an artificial wall with time measurement

subj:15017000.name: cricket
subj:15017000.description: Ball sport involving two teams of 11 players, balls, bats and wickets. The aim is to score as many runs as possible, and to get the opposing team 'out'. A 'run' involves a player running between two wickets. The opposing team try to get their rivals 'out'

subj:15018000.name: curling
subj:15018000.description: A game played on ice with large flat round stones. A player throws the stone, aiming at a target. Team mates of the player who has thrown the stone can sweep the ice in front of the stone to help smooth its path towards the target.

subj:15018001.name: icestock sport
subj:15018001.description: Similar to curling, played on targets on ice, different stones with straight handle and different rules, played in alpine countries

subj:15019000.name: cycling
subj:15019000.description: A race over a given distance on bicycles.

subj:15019001.name: track
subj:15019001.description: A race staged on a track in a velodrome

subj:15019002.name: pursuit
subj:15019002.description: Two cyclists or teams set off from midway down opposite straights and try to make up the gap between them.

subj:15019003.name: Olympic sprint
subj:15019003.description: Qualifying race held over 200m. From the quarter-finals two cyclists go head-to-heads. By teams races consist of three cyclists from different countries.

subj:15019004.name: sprint
subj:15019004.description: Races between two cyclists over two or three laps, with a timed sprint finish over the last 200m.

subj:15019005.name: Keirin
subj:15019005.description: Sprint between six cyclists where a pacemaker on a moped gradually increases the pace over the first 1400m. When the pacemaker leaves the track the race develops into a sprint finish over the final 6-700m.

subj:15019006.name: points race
subj:15019006.description: Cyclists aim to complete the highest number of laps. Bonus points are picked up in intermediate sprints held every 2500m.

subj:15019007.name: Madison race
subj:15019007.description: A points race by teams comprising two cyclists in relay-format.

subj:15019008.name: 500 m time trial
subj:15019008.description: Individual race against the clock over 500m for women.

subj:15019009.name: 1 km time trial
subj:15019009.description: Individual race over 1000m against the clock for men.

subj:15019010.name: one hour
subj:15019010.description: Competitors aim to complete as many kilometres as possible in one hour.

subj:15019011.name: road race
subj:15019011.description: Road race with all the competitor starting en masse.

subj:15019012.name: road time trial
subj:15019012.description: A race or stage against the clock with each cyclist setting off individually.

subj:15019013.name: staging race
subj:15019013.description: A race disputed by teams with the classifications determined by the combined times over a day.

subj:15019014.name: cyclo-cross
subj:15019014.description: Staged on various surfaces - earth, grass, sand or tarmac.

subj:15019016.name: Vtt-cross
subj:15019016.description: An endurance race on mountain bikes around a 10km circuit over various terrain and with different degrees of slopes. Competitors are not allowed any exterior help.

subj:15019017.name: Vtt-downhill
subj:15019017.description: Individual mountain bike race against the clock staged on a downhill circuit featuring obstacles.

subj:15019018.name: bi-crossing
subj:15019018.description: A race where competitors have to cover a circuit with obstacles as quickly as possible.

subj:15019019.name: trial
subj:15019019.description: A timed race in which competitors on mountain bikes must negotiate tricky terrain and obstacles without putting their feet down.

subj:15019020.name: artistic cycling
subj:15019020.description: Individual or teams on one or two bicycles in an arena. Points are awarded by a jury.

subj:15019021.name: cycle ball
subj:15019021.description: Competitive team sport using bicycles. One team against another with two persons per team. The aim is for competitors to move the ball using the front and rear wheels without letting their feet touch the ground.

subj:15020000.name: dancing
subj:15020000.description: Dancing competition where couples are judged on technique and interpretation.

subj:15021000.name: diving
subj:15021000.description: Competitors dive off a fixed or spring board and are assessed by seven judges giving marks up to ten for their acrobatic moves.

subj:15021001.name: 10 m platform
subj:15021001.description: Divers take off from a ten metre high platform.

subj:15021002.name: 10 m platform synchronised
subj:15021002.description: Two competitors from the same team dive off at the same time from separate platforms. As well as being judged on the standard criteria they are also awarded marks for synchronisation.

subj:15021003.name: 3 m springboard
subj:15021003.description: Divers dive from a three-metre high springboard.

subj:15021004.name: 3 m springboard synchronised
subj:15021004.description: Two competitors from the same team dive off at the same time from separate three-metre high springboards. As well as being judged on the standard criteria they are also awarded marks for synchronisation.

subj:15021005.name: subaquatics
subj:15021005.description: Sports like hockey held under water

subj:15021006.name: scuba diving
subj:15021006.description: Diving into different depths, with time measurement

subj:15022000.name: equestrian
subj:15022000.description: Sport involving a horse and rider.

subj:15022001.name: three-day event
subj:15022001.description: Equestrian event involving three disciplines - Dressage, cross-country and show jumping.

subj:15022002.name: dressage
subj:15022002.description: A rider is judged on a series of moves at three different paces - walk, trot and gallop.

subj:15022003.name: jumping
subj:15022003.description: A rider and horse attempt to jump a series of obstacles in an enclosed arena against the clock.

subj:15022004.name: cross country
subj:15022004.description: Equestrian event held on a designated circuit in the countryside featuring artificial and natural obstacles.

subj:15023000.name: fencing
subj:15023000.description: Combat sport using a sword or foil.

subj:15023001.name: epee
subj:15023001.description: category of fencing using a weapon with a triangular cross-section blade and a large bell guard.

subj:15023002.name: foil
subj:15023002.description: category of fencing using a weapon with a rectangular cross-section blade and a small bell guard.

subj:15023003.name: sabre
subj:15023003.description: a fencing weapon with a flat blade and knuckle guard used with cutting or thrusting moves.

subj:15024000.name: field Hockey
subj:15024000.description: A ball sport involving two teams of 11 players using curved sticks. The aim is to score as many goals as possible.

subj:15024001.name: roll hockey
subj:15024001.description: Team sport similar to ice hockey, executed on 4 wheel roller skates with sticks and a ball

subj:15025000.name: figure Skating
subj:15025000.description: To obtain the best marks possible from nine judges who award scores after two prepared sections - both skated to music - during which competitors must attempt to achieve the greatest possible harmony between artistic flair and technical precision.

subj:15025001.name: singles
subj:15025001.description: The individual events comprise a short program which counts for 33.3% of the score, and the free skate which is worth 66.7%.

subj:15025002.name: pairs
subj:15025002.description: The pairs event comprise a short program which counts for 33.3% of the score, and the free skate which is worth 66.7%.

subj:15025003.name: ice dance
subj:15025003.description: Takes place over three days with, in order, two compulsory dances, the original dance (2min 30sec) and the free dance (4min).

subj:15026000.name: freestyle Skiing
subj:15026000.description: Competitors perform a series of breathtaking acrobatic leaps from a prepared jump. Combined with moguls, jumps and ski ballet.

subj:15026001.name: moguls
subj:15026001.description: Contestants attack a heavily moguled slope, performing technically challenging turns and jumps, while maintaining the most direct line from the top to the bottom of the hill.

subj:15026002.name: aerials
subj:15026002.description: Competitors perform a series of aerial twists and turns from a prepared jump.

subj:15026003.name: artistic skiing
subj:15026003.description: Competitors perform a series of artistic moves (jumps and twists) all set to music. The use of ski poles is permitted.

subj:15027000.name: golf
subj:15027000.description: Competitors attempt to hit a small white ball with different clubs around a course of 18 holes varying in distance. The object is to make the fewest strokes possible.

subj:15028000.name: gymnastics
subj:15028000.description: A sport consisting of a variety of disciplines in which gymnasts perform artistic and acrobatic moves on different apparatus. There are 6 disciplines for men and 4 for women.

subj:15028001.name: floor exercise
subj:15028001.description: A gymnastics floor exercise on a 12m/sq matt.

subj:15028002.name: vault
subj:15028002.description: gymnasts propel themselves by jumping on a trampoline after running quickly down a 25m lane

subj:15028003.name: pommel horse
subj:15028003.description: Gymnasts perform an uninterrupted swing motion over a handled horse using balance and strength.

subj:15028004.name: uneven bars
subj:15028004.description: Gymnasts run through an airborne routine swinging around and between the uneven bars.

subj:15028005.name: parallel bars
subj:15028005.description: Gymnasts swing and turn with guile and grace around the parallel bars.

subj:15028006.name: horizontal bar
subj:15028006.description: Gymnasts turn, spin and perform pirouettes around the horizontal bar.

subj:15028007.name: rings
subj:15028007.description: Gymnasts perform feats of balance and strength from two suspended rings.

subj:15028008.name: beam
subj:15028008.description: Gymnasts perform leaps and flips from the much feared balance beam just 10 cm wide.

subj:15028009.name: rhythmic
subj:15028009.description: A mixture of dance and gymnastic moves.

subj:15028010.name: clubs
subj:15028010.description: Dance and gymnastic moves whilst juggling clubs.

subj:15028011.name: hoop
subj:15028011.description: A hoop is rolled and thrown whilst performing a dance routine.

subj:15028012.name: ribbon
subj:15028012.description: Gymnasts work through a pre-arranged routine whilst manipulating a spectacular length of ribbon.

subj:15028013.name: rope
subj:15028013.description: Jump and figure movements are performed while a rope is manipulated.

subj:15028014.name: ball
subj:15028014.description: An exercise based on suppleness of the body using a ball.

subj:15028015.name: trampoline
subj:15028015.description: Competitors perform complicated twists and turns whilst bouncing on the trampoline.

subj:15029000.name: handball (team)
subj:15029000.description: A ball game using the hands contested by two teams of seven trying to throw the ball into the opponents goal.

subj:15030001.name: flat racing
subj:15030001.description: A horse race over a flat course.

subj:15030002.name: steeple chase
subj:15030002.description: A mounted horse race over at least eight classic obstacles, four of which must be different, such as the water jump, spruce fences, mud walls etc.

subj:15030003.name: trotting
subj:15030003.description: Horses pitched to a jockeyed buggy race in a trot round a flat course.

subj:15030004.name: cross country
subj:15030004.description: A long distance race including rustic obstacles such as real fences, streams and fallen trees.

subj:15031000.name: ice hockey
subj:15031000.description: Two teams of six heavily padded skaters try and outscore each other by hitting a puck into the opponents goal.

subj:15031001.name: National Hockey League (North American)
subj:15031001.description: Teams from the US and Canada make up the North American continents top league.

subj:15031002.name: sledge hockey
subj:15031002.description: Like ice hockey but instead of skates small sledges are used. Competitors move by pushing with the arms

subj:15032000.name: Jai Alai (Pelota)
subj:15032000.description: Because of the game organization, the proper identification of a specific game may require the combination of 2 subject details

subj:15032001.name: fronton
subj:15032001.description: The fronton" known as "Fronton Place Libre" consists of a rectangular outdoor court plus a large pink shaped wall at one end. The two sides and the other end are left opened. "

subj:15032002.name: jai-alai
subj:15032002.description: A Jaï-Alai" is an indoor fronton with a 56 meters long court which is used exclusively to play "chistera-ancha". Three walls are used in the game: the front, the back and the left hand wall. "

subj:15032003.name: left wall
subj:15032003.description: A fronton with left hand wall" is an indoor fronton with a 36 meters long court where Pala or Main Nue are played. Three walls are used in the game: the front, the back and the left hand wall. "

subj:15032004.name: trinquet
subj:15032004.description: A Trinquet" is an indoor fronton with a 28.5 meters long court surrounded by four walls. The four walls are used in the game. "

subj:15032005.name: rebot
subj:15032005.description: The rebot" is the game played in a fronton "place libre" with 5 players in each team. They use a "chistera" (56 cm long and 12 cm large) or bare hands. "

subj:15032006.name: chistera ancha
subj:15032006.description: The chistera-ancha" also called the "cesta punta" is the game played in a "jaï alai" with 1 or 2 players in each team. The players use a long curved basket called the "chistera" (68 cm long and 13 cm wide). "

subj:15032007.name: chistera corta
subj:15032007.description: The chistera-corta" is the game played in a fronton "place libre" with left hand wall and 3 players in each team. The players use a long curved basket called the "chistera" (56 cm long and 12 cm wide). "

subj:15032008.name: bare hand
subj:15032008.description: The Main Nue" (bare hand) is the ancestor of all Basque sports. "

subj:15032009.name: pala-ancha
subj:15032009.description: The pala-ancha" is the game played in a fronton "place libre" with 2 players in each team. The players use a heavy wooden bat "the pala" (50 cm long and 20 cm wide). "

subj:15032010.name: pala-corta
subj:15032010.description: The pala-corta" is the game played in a fronton with left hand wall and 2 players in each team. The players use a heavy wooden bat the "pala-corta" (50 cm long and 10 cm wide). The "pala" is the name for a heavy wooden bat. "

subj:15032011.name: pasaka
subj:15032011.description: The pasaka" is the name of the game played in a trinquet by teams of 2 players facing each other on each side of a net where the pelota is hit between opponents. "

subj:15032012.name: xare
subj:15032012.description: The xare", is the name of the game played in a trinquet by teams of 2 players. The players use a "xare" (or the Argentina bat) 55 cm long and 16 cm wide. "

subj:15033001.name: heavyweight
subj:15033001.description: Weight categoriy in Judo: open but usually over 100kg for men and over 78kg for women

subj:15033002.name: half-heavyweight
subj:15033002.description: Weight categoriy in Judo: up to 100kg for men and 78kg for women.

subj:15033003.name: middleweight
subj:15033003.description: Weight categoriy in Judo: up to 90kg for men and 70kg for women.

subj:15033004.name: half-middleweight
subj:15033004.description: Weight categoriy in Judo: up to 81kg for men and 63kg for women.

subj:15033005.name: half-lightweight
subj:15033005.description: Weight categoriy in Judo: up to 73kg for men and 57kg for women.

subj:15033006.name: lightweight
subj:15033006.description: Weight categoriy in Judo: up to 66kg for men and 52kg for women.

subj:15033007.name: extra lightweight
subj:15033007.description: Weight categoriy in Judo: up to 60kg for men and 48kg for women.

subj:15034000.name: karate
subj:15034000.description: A martial art where chops, punches, kicks and throws are used to defeat an opponent.

subj:15034001.name: sparring
subj:15034001.description: Boxing without competition, with padded helmets

subj:15035000.name: lacrosse
subj:15035000.description: Two teams of helmeted and padded players try and outscore each other using a netted stick and hard ball.

subj:15036000.name: luge
subj:15036000.description: Luge (French word for sled) is competed in singles or doubles. The competitor(s) lay on their back(s) on an open sled and race down a course. The competitor(s) and the sled must be in contact when passing the finishing line.

subj:15036001.name: singles
subj:15036001.description: individual time trial event in a one seater luge

subj:15036002.name: doubles
subj:15036002.description: time trial for a twin berth luge

subj:15037000.name: marathon
subj:15037000.description: A road race where competitors run 42.195km, generally through city streets

subj:15038000.name: modern pentathlon
subj:15038000.description: The Modern Pentathlon comprises five events run over a single day in the following order: shooting, fencing, swimming, horse riding and running.

subj:15039000.name: motor racing
subj:15039000.description: Motor racing where speed and trusty mechanics are key

subj:15039001.name: Formula One
subj:15039001.description: Single cockpit car racing where 20 or so competitors race head to head over varied circuits around the world to win Grand Prix points in an individual and constructors championship

subj:15039002.name: F3000
subj:15039002.description: Using less powerful motors than the Formula One, designated construction teams race over varied circuits the world over in speed races for individual and team honours over a season.

subj:15039003.name: endurance
subj:15039003.description: Endurance races for a driver and co-pilot using specially built cars.

subj:15039004.name: Indy
subj:15039004.description: North American top range professional league speed racing over circuits.

subj:15039005.name: CART
subj:15039005.description: North American professional league speed racing.

subj:15039006.name: NHRA
subj:15039006.description: North American professional league speed racing.

subj:15039007.name: NASCAR
subj:15039007.description: North American professional league speed racing.

subj:15039008.name: TRUCKI
subj:15039008.description: North American professional league speed racing.

subj:15040000.name: motor rallying
subj:15040000.description: A season of endurance races over closed circuits including dirt tracks, roads and even snowy conditions featuring specials using adapted road cars with a driver and co-pilot.

subj:15040002.name: pursuit
subj:15040002.description: Cross-country race with mass start, first half of the distance in classic and the other half in free style.

subj:15041000.name: motorcycling
subj:15041000.description: Races with 2, 3 or 4 wheels vehicles with a saddle and handlebars

subj:15041001.name: speed-Grand-Prix
subj:15041001.description: A fast and furious race where every second counts

subj:15041002.name: enduro
subj:15041002.description: A race of speed, endurance and regularity over varied surfaces such as through forests and on dirt tracks

subj:15041004.name: moto-ball
subj:15041004.description: Team sport where drivers play a ball

subj:15041005.name: moto-cross
subj:15041005.description: Raced over dirt tracks featuring severe mounds

subj:15041007.name: trial
subj:15041007.description: A race of consistency and endurance over varied terrain

subj:15041008.name: endurance
subj:15041008.description: A road race of consistency and endurance

subj:15041013.name: side-cars
subj:15041013.description: Of different engine sizes but attached to a side car featuring a passenger

subj:15042000.name: netball
subj:15042000.description: A woman's sport similar to basketball without a board behind the basket

subj:15043000.name: nordic skiing
subj:15043000.description: Practiced in snowy countryside and based on power and endurance. There are classic and free style events with mass or staggered starts.

subj:15043002.name: 5 km classical time
subj:15043002.description: A 5km classic race in that the competitor keeps his skis parallel except on steep inclines where the scissor move is used

subj:15043003.name: 10 km classical style
subj:15043003.description: A 10km classic race in that the competitor keeps his skis parallel except on steep inclines where the scissor move is used

subj:15043004.name: 10 km pursuit free style
subj:15043004.description: Staggered start depending on positions with competitors using a skating like technique on skis

subj:15043005.name: 15 km classical style
subj:15043005.description: A 15km race using the classical style of keeping skies parallel

subj:15043006.name: 15 km pursuit free style
subj:15043006.description: 15km race with staggered start using free style technique similar to a skating motion

subj:15043008.name: 30 km classical style
subj:15043008.description: A 30km classic race in that the competitor keeps his skis parallel except on steep inclines where the scissor move is used

subj:15043009.name: 30km free style
subj:15043009.description: A 30km free-style race where the most common style is the skate style where competitors slide and the skis do not need to be parallel

subj:15043010.name: 50 km free style
subj:15043010.description: A 50km free style race where the most common style is the skate style where competitors slide and the skis do not need to be parallel

subj:15043011.name: 4x5 km relay
subj:15043011.description: Teams of four competitors ski 5km each in relay fashion

subj:15043012.name: 4x10 km relay
subj:15043012.description: Teams of four competitors ski 10km each in relay fashion

subj:15043013.name: nordic combined
subj:15043013.description: A two day competition combining the ski jump and a cross-country race.

subj:15043015.name: 5 km pursuit free style
subj:15043015.description: Cross-country skiing over a 5km course in a pursuit format

subj:15043016.name: 1.5 km sprint free
subj:15043016.description: Cross-country skiing over a 1.5km course in a sprint format

subj:15043017.name: 50 km classic style
subj:15043017.description: Cross-country skiing over a 50km course in a classic style format

subj:15044000.name: orienteering
subj:15044000.description: An individual time-trial over a route marked out by beacons. The competitor has to search out and find in a specific order. The contestant makes his way with the help of a compass and map

subj:15044001.name: ski orienteering
subj:15044001.description: An individual ski time-trial over a route marked out by beacons, that the competitor has to search out and find in a specific order. The contestant makes his way with the help of a compass and map

subj:15045000.name: polo
subj:15045000.description: With the aid of a mallet two teams of four horsemen try and knock a bamboo ball into the opponents goal over a pitch 250m long and 150m wide. The game is divided into 4, 6, or 8 time periods of 7min 30sec called chukkas.

subj:15046000.name: power boating
subj:15046000.description: Races between motor boats on rivers or lakes

subj:15047000.name: rowing
subj:15047000.description: Boat racing usually on flat calm waters with boats for 1, 2, 4 or 8 rowers

subj:15047001.name: single sculls
subj:15047001.description: Single person boats with two oars

subj:15047002.name: double sculls
subj:15047002.description: Two person boats with two oars each

subj:15047003.name: quadruple sculls
subj:15047003.description: Four person boats with two oars each and without a team mate to give directions

subj:15047004.name: coxless pair
subj:15047004.description: Two person boats with just one oar each and without a team mate to give directions

subj:15047005.name: coxless four
subj:15047005.description: Four person boats with just one oar each and without a team mate to give directions

subj:15047006.name: eight
subj:15047006.description: Eight person boats with just one oar each and without a team mate to give directions

subj:15047007.name: lightweight
subj:15047007.description: Where a weight category is imposed on competitors

subj:15048000.name: rugby league
subj:15048000.description: Two teams of 13 compete on a pitch where they score tries and penalties by running with and passing an oval ball to be touched down behind the goal line or kicked between goal posts in a tough physical contest

subj:15049000.name: rugby union
subj:15049000.description: Two teams of 15 compete on a pitch where they score tries and penalties by running with and passing an oval ball to be touched down behind the goal line or kicked between goal posts in a tough physical contest

subj:15049001.name: rugby 7
subj:15049001.description: A more fun and exciting variety where two teams of 7 compete on a pitch where they score tries and penalties by running with and passing an oval ball to be touched down behind the goal line or kicked between goal posts in a tough physical contest

subj:15050000.name: sailing
subj:15050000.description: Sail boat racing over a route marked by buoys.

subj:15050001.name: Tornado
subj:15050001.description: Boat Category: two man catamaran (21m/sq mainsail) Olympic sport

subj:15050002.name: soling
subj:15050002.description: Boat Category: three man keel boat

subj:15050003.name: 49er
subj:15050003.description: Boat Category: two man dinghy (8.23m/sq mainsail) Olympic sport

subj:15050004.name: Europe
subj:15050004.description: Boat Category: one man dinghy (4.57m/sq mainsail) Olympic sport

subj:15050005.name: Laser
subj:15050005.description: Boat Category: one man dinghy (4.6m/sq mainsail) Olympic sport

subj:15050006.description: Boat Category: two man dinghy (7.10m/sq mainsail) Olympic sport

subj:15050007.name: Finn
subj:15050007.description: Boat Category: one man dinghy (10m/sq mainsail) Olympic sport

subj:15050008.name: Star
subj:15050008.description: Boat Category: two man keel boat (7.10m/sq mainsail) Olympic sport

subj:15050015.name: yngling
subj:15050015.description: Olympic boat-class. A race around different courses in a boat of 6.35 metres (20ft 10in) long and 1.73 metres (5ft 8in) wide, crewed in Olympic competition only by women. The number of races and the length of the courses varies.

subj:15050016.name: mistral
subj:15050016.description: Olympic boat class. A staged race using boats of the mistral type, which are 4.24 metres (13ft 11in) long and 1.3 metres (4ft 3in) wide. The number of races and the length of the courses varies.

subj:15051000.name: shooting
subj:15051000.description: Precision sport using a hand gun, rifle or shotgun

subj:15051011.name: double trap
subj:15051011.description: Shooting event with two moving targets launched at the same time

subj:15051012.name: skeet
subj:15051012.description: Shooting event with moving targets, competitor shoots from a series of positions

subj:15052000.name: ski jumping
subj:15052000.description: Competitors descend a snow covered elevated ramp on skis and try to fly off it as far as possible, receiving marks for distance, style of flight and landing

subj:15052001.name: K90 jump
subj:15052001.description: Competitors jump from 70m and must clear 90m distance in their jump before scoring points for it

subj:15052002.name: K120 jump
subj:15052002.description: Competitors jump from 90m and must clear 120m distance in their jump before scoring points for it

subj:15052003.name: K180 (flying jump)
subj:15052003.description: Competitors jump from 180m and must clear 180m in their jump before scoring points for it

subj:15053000.name: snow boarding
subj:15053000.description: Practiced with a single board (rather than two skis)

subj:15053002.name: half-pipe
subj:15053002.description: Over a semi-cylindrical tube of 100m competitors must perform a series of moves that are marked for style by 5 judges

subj:15054000.name: soccer
subj:15054000.description: Two teams of eleven try to kick or head a ball into the opponents goal over a match usually of 90 minutes

subj:15055000.name: softball
subj:15055000.description: Similar to baseball but with a larger and softer ball, a thinner bat, shorter gaps between bases and less innings

subj:15056000.name: speed skating
subj:15056000.description: Timed races competed by two skaters at a time on an oval ice track

subj:15056007.name: Short-track
subj:15056007.description: Races of four or more skaters on an oval ice track. Qualifying, semi-finals and finals determine winners.

subj:15056008.name: st 500 m
subj:15056008.description: Short track speed skate race over 500m

subj:15056009.name: st 1000m
subj:15056009.description: Short track speed skate race over 1000m

subj:15056010.name: st 1500m
subj:15056010.description: Short track speed skate race over 1500m

subj:15056011.name: st 3000m
subj:15056011.description: Short track speed skate race over 3000m

subj:15056012.name: st 3000m relay
subj:15056012.description: Short track relay speed skate race over 3000m

subj:15056013.name: st 5000m
subj:15056013.description: Short track speed skate race over 5000m

subj:15056014.name: st 5000m relay
subj:15056014.description: Short track relay speed skate race over 5000m

subj:15058000.name: sports organisations
subj:15058000.description: Organisations responsible for a specific sport

subj:15058002.name: international federation
subj:15058002.description: A body responsible for the international coordination of a specific sport

subj:15058003.name: continental federation
subj:15058003.description: A body responsible for the continental coordination of a specific sport

subj:15058004.name: national federation
subj:15058004.description: A body responsible for the national coordination of a specific sport

subj:15058005.name: GAISF
subj:15058005.description: General Association of International Sports Federations

subj:15059000.name: squash
subj:15059000.description: A racket sport of strategy and endurance played by singles or doubles teams in a walled court with a small rubber ball

subj:15060000.name: sumo wrestling
subj:15060000.description: A combat sport of speed and rapidity with much ceremony where two contestants try to throw or slap a competitor out of a marked area. Generally practiced in Japan by large men.

subj:15061000.name: surfing
subj:15061000.description: Water sport where contestants catch and ride waves upright on a surfboard

subj:15062000.name: swimming
subj:15062000.description: A water sport where contestants swim as fast as possible in a given style and win races by being the first to touch home

subj:15062001.name: 50 m freestyle
subj:15062001.description: Competitors cover 50m in any style, though front crawl is universally employed

subj:15062002.name: 100 m freestyle
subj:15062002.description: Competitors cover 100m in any style, though front crawl is universally employed

subj:15062003.name: 200 m freestyle
subj:15062003.description: Competitors cover 200m in any style, though front crawl is universally employed

subj:15062004.name: 400 m freestyle
subj:15062004.description: Competitors cover 400m in any style, though front crawl is universally employed

subj:15062005.name: 800 m freestyle
subj:15062005.description: Competitors cover 800m in any style, though front crawl is universally employed

subj:15062006.name: 1500 m freestyle
subj:15062006.description: Competitors cover 1500m in any style, though front crawl is universally employed

subj:15062007.name: relay 4x50 m freestyle
subj:15062007.description: Teams of four swimmers cover 50m freestyle in a 200m race

subj:15062008.name: relay 4x100 m freestyle
subj:15062008.description: Teams of four swimmers cover 100m freestyle in a 400m race

subj:15062009.name: relay 4x200 m freestyle
subj:15062009.description: Teams of four swimmers cover 200m freestyle in a 800m race

subj:15062010.name: 50 m backstroke
subj:15062010.description: Competitors cover 50m in the backstroke style

subj:15062011.name: 100 m backstroke
subj:15062011.description: Competitors cover 100m in the backstroke style

subj:15062012.name: 200 m backstroke
subj:15062012.description: Competitors cover 200m in the backstroke style

subj:15062013.name: 50 m breaststroke
subj:15062013.description: A 50m race in the breaststroke style, on the front, effecting forward and outward push movements with the arms and backward and outward pushes with the legs

subj:15062014.name: 100 m breaststroke
subj:15062014.description: A 100m race in the breaststroke style, on the front, effecting forward and outward push movements with the arms and backward and outward pushes with the legs

subj:15062015.name: 200 m breaststroke
subj:15062015.description: A 200m race in the breaststroke style, on the front, effecting forward and outward push movements with the arms and backward and outward pushes with the legs

subj:15062016.name: 50 m butterfly
subj:15062016.description: A 50m butterfly race, swum on the front with the shoulders remaining parallel to the water both arms moving in simultaneous windmill fashion, the legs remain together and are moved in a flapping motion. The most physical of all styles.

subj:15062017.name: 100 m butterfly
subj:15062017.description: A 100m butterfly race, swum on the front with the shoulders remaining parallel to the water both arms moving in simultaneous windmill fashion, the legs remain together and are moved in a flapping motion. The most physical of all styles

subj:15062018.name: 200 m butterfly
