subj:15062018.description: A 200m butterfly race, swum on the front with the shoulders remaining parallel to the water both arms moving in simultaneous windmill fashion, the legs remain together and are moved in a flapping motion. The most physical of all styles

subj:15062019.name: 100 m medley
subj:15062019.description: Swimmers complete four laps, each in a different style and in this order: butterfly, backstroke, breaststroke and freestyle, covering a total of 100m.

subj:15062020.name: 200 m medley
subj:15062020.description: Swimmers complete four laps, each in a different style and in this order: butterfly, backstroke, breaststroke and freestyle, covering a total of 200m.

subj:15062021.name: 400 m medley
subj:15062021.description: Swimmers complete eight laps, two in each style and in this order: butterfly, backstroke, breaststroke and freestyle, covering a total of 400m.

subj:15062022.name: relay 4x50 m medlay
subj:15062022.description: A relay team of four, each of whom completes a single lap and each in a different style in this order: backstroke, breaststroke, butterfly and freestyle in a race of 200m total.

subj:15062023.name: relay4x100 m medley
subj:15062023.description: A relay team of four, each of whom completes two laps and each in a different style in this order: backstroke, breaststroke, butterfly and freestyle in a race of 400m total.

subj:15062024.name: short course
subj:15062024.description: Races competed in a 25m length pool

subj:15062025.name: synchronised technical routine
subj:15062025.description: Contestants obtain points from 10 sitting judges by executing certain synchronised artistic shapes and movements in the water. In the technical programme, competitors must execute a range of specific moves in a given order.

subj:15062026.name: synchronised free routine
subj:15062026.description: In the free programme, music, movements and their order of execution are not restricted.

subj:15063000.name: table tennis
subj:15063000.description: A racket sport for two or four (in doubles), who compete at a table divided by a net using a small bat to play a lightweight ball

subj:15064000.name: Taekwon-Do
subj:15064000.description: A martial art of Korean origin

subj:15065000.name: tennis
subj:15065000.description: A sport where two players, four in doubles, equipped with a racket compete by hitting the ball over a net into the opponent's side of the court with the aim of putting it out of reach within the regulation lines, thus winning points.

subj:15065001.name: soft tennis
subj:15065001.description: Tennis with a soft rubber ball. (Programme of National Sports Festival in Japan)

subj:15066000.name: triathlon
subj:15066000.description: An endurance multi-sport where competitors first swim, then cycle and then run a road race. Distances vary according to the competition, the Olympic version being 1.5, 40 and 10km respectively.

subj:15067000.name: volleyball
subj:15067000.description: Two teams of six record points by hitting a ball over a net into the opponent's half of the court, keeping it in the air at all times. Points are won when opponents fail to return the ball.

subj:15067001.name: beach volleyball
subj:15067001.description: Two teams of two players compete on a sand court. Unlike indoor volleyball, points are scored only when the serving team wins a rally or forces an error. The sand surface makes it more physically demanding than volleyball.

subj:15068000.name: water polo
subj:15068000.description: Played in a pool between two teams of 7, who must stay afloat and can only use one hand to pass the ball or swim with it before trying to throw it into the opponents net to score goals.

subj:15069000.name: water skiing
subj:15069000.description: On one or two skis contestants are pulled by a power boat along the water's surface

subj:15069001.name: slalom
subj:15069001.description: Speed event where contestants round a course marked out by buoys

subj:15069002.name: trick
subj:15069002.description: Skiers perform a maximum of figures in a limited time period

subj:15069003.name: jump
subj:15069003.description: Skiers perform as long a jump as possible from a ramp in the water

subj:15069004.name: combined
subj:15069004.description: A combined event made up of the slalom, jump and trick

subj:15070000.name: weightlifting
subj:15070000.description: A strength test where competitors lift as heavy a weight as possible

subj:15070001.name: snatch
subj:15070001.description: The bar must be lifted from floor to above the head in one movement

subj:15070002.name: clean and jerk
subj:15070002.description: The bar is first lifted to the shoulders and then jerk it above the head and keep it there while maintaining straight legs

subj:15070016.name: powerlifting
subj:15070016.description: A strength test where competitors lift as heavy a weight as possible

subj:15071000.name: windsurfing
subj:15071000.description: Contestants must complete a marked out course as fast as possible on a windsurf board

subj:15071004.name: land
subj:15071004.description: Races competed on land with a board equipped with wheels

subj:15072000.name: wrestling
subj:15072000.description: Combat sport where each wrestler attempts to win over his adversary, by holding both shoulders on the ground (fall) long enough to be in control. Points can also be decisive.

subj:15072001.name: freestyle
subj:15072001.description: A style where leg holds are allowed

subj:15072002.name: greco-roman
subj:15072002.description: A style where the only holds allowed are those between the head and the belt

subj:15072012.name: Swiss wrestling
subj:15072012.description: Traditional Swiss sport similar to wrestling with specific rules

subj:15073017.name: World games
subj:15073017.description: A competition featuring world class athletes

subj:15073018.name: World Cup
subj:15073018.description: Sports meeting with competitors from the five continents

subj:15073019.name: intercontinental cup
subj:15073019.description: Sports meeting bringing together competitors from different continents

subj:15073020.name: continental cup
subj:15073020.description: Sports meeting where competitors come from a single continent

subj:15073021.name: international cup
subj:15073021.description: Sports meeting where competitors come from several nations

subj:15073022.name: National Cup
subj:15073022.description: Sports meeting where competitors come from a single nation

subj:15073023.name: interregional cup
subj:15073023.description: Sports meeting where competitors come from several regions

subj:15073024.name: regional cup
subj:15073024.description: Sports meeting where competitors come from a single region

subj:15073025.name: league cup
subj:15073025.description: A competition within a sports league

subj:15073026.name: world championship
subj:15073026.description: A championship where competitors from the five continents take part

subj:15073027.name: intercontinental championship
subj:15073027.description: A championship where competitors from the different continents take part

subj:15073028.name: continental championship 1st level
subj:15073028.description: A championship where top level competitors from a single continent take part

subj:15073029.name: continental championship 2nd level
subj:15073029.description: A championship where second string competitors from a single continent take part

subj:15073030.name: continental championship 3rd level
subj:15073030.description: A championship where third string competitors from a single continent take part

subj:15073031.name: national championship 1st level
subj:15073031.description: A championship where top level competitors from a single nation take part

subj:15073032.name: national championship 2nd level
subj:15073032.description: A championship where second string competitors from a single continent take part

subj:15073033.name: national championship3rdlevel
subj:15073033.description: A championship where third string competitors from a single continent take part

subj:15073034.name: national championship 4th level
subj:15073034.description: A championship where fourth string competitors from a single continent take part

subj:15073035.name: regional championship
subj:15073035.description: A championship where competitors from a single region take part

subj:15073036.name: Grand Prix
subj:15073036.description: High level sports competition, most often motor racing

subj:15073037.name: intercontinental tournament
subj:15073037.description: Tournament where competitors from several continents take part

subj:15073038.name: continental tournament
subj:15073038.description: Tournament where competitors from a single continent take part

subj:15073039.name: international tournament
subj:15073039.description: Tournament where competitors from several nations take part

subj:15073040.name: national tournament
subj:15073040.description: Tournament where competitors from a single nation take part

subj:15073041.name: inter-nations competition
subj:15073041.description: Tournament where athletes from several nations take part

subj:15073042.name: inter-clubs competition
subj:15073042.description: Tournament where competitors from several clubs take part

subj:15073043.name: friendly competition
subj:15073043.description: Sports played but not in a tournament

subj:15073044.name: all-stars competition
subj:15073044.description: Competition between teams made up of invited stars

subj:15073046.name: Super Bowl
subj:15073046.description: The American football final that determines the champion

subj:15073047.name: paralympic games
subj:15073047.description: Olympic style Games for athletes with a disability

subj:15074000.name: rodeo
subj:15074000.description: A discipline where wild horses or bulls must be mounted and mastered

subj:15075000.name: mini golf sport
subj:15075000.description: A game where balls must be holed on an artificial course in as few strokes from the club as possible

subj:15076000.name: bandy
subj:15076000.description: Played outdoors on ice. The size of the ice rink is about the size of a soccer field. Skates like ice hockey. A small hard ball is used for playing. Players play with sticks, much like in ice hockey, but the sticks are shorter and more rounded.

subj:15077000.name: flying disc
subj:15077000.description: A group of events all played with a flying plastic disc. The exact regulation for the disc is different in different events but it has to be unbroken of solid plastic and a production model with no modification. Flying disc is sometimes called Frisbee.

subj:15077001.name: ultimate
subj:15077001.description: Team game. Played outdoors on soccer-size field with 7 players per team and indoors with 5 players per team. Games are played to a preset number of goals. Goals are scored by passing the disc to a team-member catching it inside the goal area.

subj:15077002.name: guts
subj:15077002.description: Team game where two teams of 5 players each face each other. Teams take turns to throw the disc towards the other team. Points are scored if the opposing team does not catch the disc.

subj:15077003.name: overall
subj:15077003.description: Not an event in itself but in most competitions with individual events the winner of the competition will be awarded to the player with the highest combined score in the events.

subj:15077004.name: distance
subj:15077004.description: The object is to throw the disc as far as possible. Each player get five throws per turn. Throws are made downwind. World record is over 200 meters.

subj:15077005.name: discathon
subj:15077005.description: The object is to throw and run a park course of about 1 kilometre. Four players compete in each heat. They have two discs each. They may also carry a third disc in reserve. Where one thrown disc stops the second disc must be thrown.

subj:15077006.name: DDC
subj:15077006.description: Abbreviation for Double Disc Court. Two players per team in a square 13x13 metre. The teams start with one disc per team and throw at each other. Discs are thrown back and forth until one or both hit the ground.

subj:15077007.name: SCF
subj:15077007.description: Abbreviation for Self Caught Flights. Divided into two sub events called MTA (Maximum Time Aloft) and TRC (Throw Run Catch). In both sub events the player throws a disc and then runs to catch it with one hand before it hits the ground.

subj:15077008.name: freestyle
subj:15077008.description: A judged event where groups of two or three players perform as many tricks as possible. In competitions the judges can use either a ranking system or set scores on presentation, execution and difficulty.

subj:15077009.name: accuracy
subj:15077009.description: Each player has 28 throws from various distances and angles to throw the disc through a goal 1.5 x 1.5 meters. World record is 25 of 28 possible.

subj:15077010.name: disc golf
subj:15077010.description: Much like golf but played with discs instead of balls and clubs. Instead of a hole in the ground there is a metal basket with light metal chains to throw the disc at. Players often carry discs specialized for long throws, right or left bends.

subj:15078000.name: floorball
subj:15078000.description: Played indoors in a court the size of a basketball court. 6 players per team, of which one is a who plays in a kneeling position without a stick like in ice hockey. The other players use plastic clubs and a light plastic ball to pass and shoot goals.

subj:15079000.name: casting
subj:15079000.description: Using fishing equipment to hit a target and score points

subj:15080000.name: tug-of-war
subj:15080000.description: Two teams pulling against each other on a rope

subj:15081000.name: croquette
subj:15081000.description: Using mallets to hit a ball through hoops

subj:15082002.name: oval track
subj:15082002.description: Pursuing an artificial rabbit around an oval track

subj:15083000.name: skeleton
subj:15083000.description: In skeleton the competitor lays on his/hers stomach when racing down the course. The competitor must be on the sled when crossing the finishing line. The total time of all races in a competition is added together.

subj:15087000.name: hornuss
subj:15087000.description: Swiss team sport with 16 or 18 men per team. A rubber puck is hit towards the field of the adversary team which tries to hit the puck in the air with a wooden board thrown in the air

subj:15088000.name: fist ball
subj:15088000.description: Men's team sport similar to volleyball (with a much lower net) executed mainly in gymnastics clubs

subj:15090000.name: grass ski
subj:15090000.description: Alpine skiing on roller skis and grass

subj:15091000.name: snowbiking
subj:15091000.description: Individual sport on snow on a snow bike, the athlete has two mini skis, previous name: ski bob

subj:15092000.name: twirling
subj:15092000.description: Team competition with majorettes and a jury

subj:15093000.name: kendo
subj:15093000.description: Japanese traditional martial art using a bamboo sword, sometimes called Japanese fencing. (Programme of National Sports Festival in Japan)

subj:15094000.name: jukendo
subj:15094000.description: Japanese traditional martial art using a model rifle made of wood. Juken" means a rifle or gun with blade (bayonet). (Programme of National Sports Festival in Japan) "

subj:15095000.name: naginata
subj:15095000.description: Japanese traditional martial art using a pole sword made of wood. Naginata" means a spear with a curved blade. (Programme of National Sports Festival in Japan) "

subj:15096000.name: kyudo
subj:15096000.description: Japanese traditional martial art using a bamboo bow and arrows, sometimes called Japanese archery. (Programme of National Sports Festival in Japan)

subj:15097000.name: kabaddi
subj:15097000.description: The attacking side scores by touching, and the side to guard scores by capturing. The attacker continues calling it kabaddi". "

subj:15098000.name: sepak takraw
subj:15098000.description: The game like volleyball which must not use a hand. The ball made of rattan is used. (Programme of National Sports Festival in Japan)

subj:15099000.name: wushu
subj:15099000.description: Generally, Chinese traditional martial art. (Programme of National Sports Festival in Japan)

subj:15100000.name: darts
subj:15100000.description: Two players compete by throwing metal darts at a wall-mounted circular board divided radially into segments of different scores

subj:15101000.name: bodybuilding
subj:15101000.description: A person displays pronounced muscle tone and exaggerated muscle mass and definition for overall aesthetic effect

subj:15102000.name: sports disciplinary action
subj:15102000.description: Actions, including fines and suspensions levied by sports organisations and teams

subj:15103000.name: sports awards
subj:15103000.description: Awards and honors given by sports organisations or won by sports figures

subj:16000000.name: unrest, conflicts and war
subj:16000000.description: Acts of socially or politically motivated protest and/or violence.

subj:16001000.name: act of terror
subj:16001000.description: Act of violence, often deadly, designed to raise fear and anxiety in a population

subj:16002000.name: armed conflict
subj:16002000.description: Disputes between opposing groups involving the use of weaponry, but not formally declared a war

subj:16003000.name: civil unrest
subj:16003000.description: Dissatisfaction among the general population as evidenced by rallies, strikes, demonstrations or sabotage

subj:16003001.name: revolutions
subj:16003001.description: An often violent change in a nation's system of government by internal forces that results in systematic social change.

subj:16003002.name: rebellions
subj:16003002.description: Armed uprising by citizens of a nation with the intent to overthrow the government, without necessarily achieving social change

subj:16003003.name: political dissent
subj:16003003.description: Disagreement between political groups, usually organized and sometimes resulting in imprisonment of the dissenters

subj:16004000.name: coup d'etat
subj:16004000.description: The overthrow of an established government by an organized group, often the military or a political party

subj:16005000.name: guerrilla activity
subj:16005000.description: Anti-government actions by clandestine groups using hit-and-run techniques or sabotage, kidnapping and the like

subj:16005001.name: bioterrorism
subj:16005001.description: Use of biological agent to raise the level of fear within a population, whether deaths occur or not.

subj:16005002.name: bombings
subj:16005002.description: Use of explosive devices against people, buildings or structures

subj:16006000.name: massacre
subj:16006000.description: The death of a large group of people over a brief period of time

subj:16006001.name: genocide
subj:16006001.description: Systematic killing of one clan, tribe or ethnic type by another

subj:16007000.name: riots
subj:16007000.description: Violent, destructive demonstrations often involving injury to individuals and destruction of property

subj:16008000.name: demonstration
subj:16008000.description: A public show of feeling or opinion, as by a mass meeting or parade

subj:16009000.name: war
subj:16009000.description: A formal declaration of hostilities by one country against another

subj:16009001.name: civil war
subj:16009001.description: Armed conflict between members of the same nation or geographical region, in some cases with a desire to divide the nation or region.

subj:16009002.name: international military intervention
subj:16009002.description: Temporary use of international forces by invitation or by a decision of an outside body in another country or region for the purpose of resolving a crisis.

subj:16009003.name: prisoners and detainees
subj:16009003.description: People captured and imprisoned by their enemy during war or armed conflict

subj:16010000.name: conflict (general)
subj:16010000.description: A dispute which can be at several levels,

subj:16010001.name: peacekeeping force
subj:16010001.description: Varied national military forces under unified international command to maintain order in disputed areas.

subj:16011000.name: crisis
subj:16011000.description: Conflict of all kinds that rises to a level where, depending on events, governments can fall, war be declared or stock markets crash, or not

subj:16012000.name: weaponry
subj:16012000.description: Armaments of all types used to conduct war

subj:17000000.name: weather
subj:17000000.description: The study, reporting and prediction of meteorological phenomena.

subj:17001000.name: forecast
subj:17001000.description: Prediction of the course of the weather in the future either near term or long term

subj:17002000.name: global change
subj:17002000.description: The determination whether the Earth is getting warm, or colder, whether seas are rising or falling and the like

subj:17003000.name: report
subj:17003000.description: Any distributed announcement about the weather

subj:17004000.name: statistic
subj:17004000.description: Numerical facts about the weather such as temperature, barometric pressure, river levels, humidity, high and low tides and the like

subj:17005000.name: warning
subj:17005000.description: Alerts to the general populace about severe weather coming their way
